name: Fleece Stingray
textHtml: While its ancestors may have been wavekin, subsequent generations' extended exposure to submarine wind crystals has aided the fleece stingray's evolution into its current form. Great flocks (schools?) of the white-bellied rays are sometimes mistaken for swift-moving rain clouds.
textClean: While its ancestors may have been wavekin, subsequent generations' extended exposure to submarine wind crystals has aided the fleece stingray's evolution into its current form. Great flocks (schools?) of the white-bellied rays are sometimes mistaken for swift-moving rain clouds.

name: Nyctosaur
textHtml: The function of the enlarged comb which protrudes from the center of the nyctosaur's head has yet to be determined by the realm's naturalists, with some scholars believing it stores water, much like a dromedary's hump, while other believe it to be a hollow chamber which serves to deepen and amplify mating calls.
textClean: The function of the enlarged comb which protrudes from the center of the nyctosaur's head has yet to be determined by the realm's naturalists, with some scholars believing it stores water, much like a dromedary's hump, while other believe it to be a hollow chamber which serves to deepen and amplify mating calls.

name: Priestfish
textHtml: The crozier-like bioluminescent proboscis dangling from the priestfish's forehead attracts prey in the murky depths of the pools in which this distant cousin of the monkfish resides.
textClean: The crozier-like bioluminescent proboscis dangling from the priestfish's forehead attracts prey in the murky depths of the pools in which this distant cousin of the monkfish resides.

name: Coerthan Oyster
textHtml: The shells of these freshwater mollusks are so impenetrable that local fishers have dubbed them “the Fury's shields.” Luckily, prying them from the rocks upon which they live is as simple as sliding a knife beneath their shells and giving a slight pull upwards.
textClean: The shells of these freshwater mollusks are so impenetrable that local fishers have dubbed them “the Fury's shields.” Luckily, prying them from the rocks upon which they live is as simple as sliding a knife beneath their shells and giving a slight pull upwards.

name: Oliphant's Trunk
textHtml: Similar to an electric eel, the near-blind oliphant's trunk emits low-frequency electrical pulses into surrounding waters in order to better locate its prey.
textClean: Similar to an electric eel, the near-blind oliphant's trunk emits low-frequency electrical pulses into surrounding waters in order to better locate its prey.

name: Mountain Kraken
textHtml: For centuries, the legend of Saint Daniffen and the Kraken was thought to be only that─a fantastical tale spun by the See to beatify the life of an otherwise kindly, yet ordinary, man. That is, until a giant cephalopod was found lurking in a mountain lake.
textClean: For centuries, the legend of Saint Daniffen and the Kraken was thought to be only that─a fantastical tale spun by the See to beatify the life of an otherwise kindly, yet ordinary, man. That is, until a giant cephalopod was found lurking in a mountain lake.

name: Armored Catfish
textHtml: Sharlayan scholars who studied this peculiar variety of catfish at length before returning to their homeland claim that the species is not a wavekin like its cousins, but rather a scalekin that, after many eons residing in water, shed its legs for fins.
textClean: Sharlayan scholars who studied this peculiar variety of catfish at length before returning to their homeland claim that the species is not a wavekin like its cousins, but rather a scalekin that, after many eons residing in water, shed its legs for fins.

name: Magic Bucket
textHtml: There was once a young fisher-cum-sorceress who, cursing the fact she was born with only two hands with which to carry her myriad tackle, called upon the power of unseen spirits to ensorcell a bucket to transport her catch...only to watch it sink to the bottom of a lake when her concentration was broken by a crayfish nipping at her ankles.
textClean: There was once a young fisher-cum-sorceress who, cursing the fact she was born with only two hands with which to carry her myriad tackle, called upon the power of unseen spirits to ensorcell a bucket to transport her catch...only to watch it sink to the bottom of a lake when her concentration was broken by a crayfish nipping at her ankles.

name: Fat Purse
textHtml: So plump does this rare Coerthan puffer grow when intimidated, that anglers began playfully comparing the fish to the bursting-with-coin purses oft flaunted by Ishgardian nobles.
textClean: So plump does this rare Coerthan puffer grow when intimidated, that anglers began playfully comparing the fish to the bursting-with-coin purses oft flaunted by Ishgardian nobles.

name: The Impaler
textHtml: One morning, while on patrol, a knight hailing from Falcon's Nest spied the fallen corpse of a yeti near one of Dragonspit's bubbling pools. Upon further investigation, he determined the cause of death to be a massive urchin spine embedded in the creature's foot. An Ishgardian naturalist who later examined the spine estimated the original urchin at several yalms in diameter...give or take several yalms.
textClean: One morning, while on patrol, a knight hailing from Falcon's Nest spied the fallen corpse of a yeti near one of Dragonspit's bubbling pools. Upon further investigation, he determined the cause of death to be a massive urchin spine embedded in the creature's foot. An Ishgardian naturalist who later examined the spine estimated the original urchin at several yalms in diameter...give or take several yalms.

name: La Reale
textHtml: This oversized battle galley with a tendency to stun its prey by ramming it with its sharp, pointed jaw, was named after a legendary steam-powered ship built by the Holy See to patrol the waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.
textClean: This oversized battle galley with a tendency to stun its prey by ramming it with its sharp, pointed jaw, was named after a legendary steam-powered ship built by the Holy See to patrol the waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.

name: Scaleripper
textHtml: Lost between drunken tales of swallowing Lalafells whole and swallowing a whole lot of Lalafells, is a hushed yarn spun in smoky taverns about a shadowhisker with an unnatural appetite for slightly larger prey─dragons.
textClean: Lost between drunken tales of swallowing Lalafells whole and swallowing a whole lot of Lalafells, is a hushed yarn spun in smoky taverns about a shadowhisker with an unnatural appetite for slightly larger prey─dragons.

name: The Dreamweaver
textHtml: If the clickings of the Vath braveheart are to be believed, the soul of this elusive warmwater bichir rises each night from the Smoldering Wastes to invade his mind and torment his dreams.
textClean: If the clickings of the Vath braveheart are to be believed, the soul of this elusive warmwater bichir rises each night from the Smoldering Wastes to invade his mind and torment his dreams.

name: Meteortoise
textHtml: This mountain-dwelling tortoise will heat its shell until it glows meteor red, then leap from its lava pool, falling back first onto its prey to both slay and cook it in one fell stroke.
textClean: This mountain-dwelling tortoise will heat its shell until it glows meteor red, then leap from its lava pool, falling back first onto its prey to both slay and cook it in one fell stroke.

name: The Ewer King
textHtml: While the Thaliak River with its majestic waterfall the Tipped Ewer is home to countless creatures large and small, only one has the size, strength, and cunning to be crowned “king.”
textClean: While the Thaliak River with its majestic waterfall the Tipped Ewer is home to countless creatures large and small, only one has the size, strength, and cunning to be crowned “king.”

name: Vidofnir
textHtml: Incomparable size combined with a decided lack of pigment in this noontide oscar's skin invokes comparisons to the great white dragon, Vidofnir.
textClean: Incomparable size combined with a decided lack of pigment in this noontide oscar's skin invokes comparisons to the great white dragon, Vidofnir.

name: The Soul of the Martyr
textHtml: The moogles of Moghome insist that they have witnessed the passing of legendary Ratatoskr's essence into its secondary vessel─the very fish that lies motionless at the bottom of your bag. Let us hope they are mistaken.
textClean: The moogles of Moghome insist that they have witnessed the passing of legendary Ratatoskr's essence into its secondary vessel─the very fish that lies motionless at the bottom of your bag. Let us hope they are mistaken.

name: Inkfish
textHtml: Despite the suggestion by its name that this unique bubble eye goldfish has the ability to spit like a squid, the inkfish earns its name from the black patterns on its body thought to resemble the ever-changing whorls created when ink is spilled into water.
textClean: Despite the suggestion by its name that this unique bubble eye goldfish has the ability to spit like a squid, the inkfish earns its name from the black patterns on its body thought to resemble the ever-changing whorls created when ink is spilled into water.

name: The Second One
textHtml: As if there was not already “enough said” regarding tornado sharks, sightings of an even larger and more violent example of these freaks of nature have the Rose Knights on edge.
textClean: As if there was not already “enough said” regarding tornado sharks, sightings of an even larger and more violent example of these freaks of nature have the Rose Knights on edge.

name: Augmented High Allagan Helmet
textHtml: With a shell even harder than a typical Allagan helmet, this biological aberration feeds by releasing a highly corrosive substance onto rocks, dissolving them into a foul solution which is then slurped back up using the wavekin's straw-like tongue.
textClean: With a shell even harder than a typical Allagan helmet, this biological aberration feeds by releasing a highly corrosive substance onto rocks, dissolving them into a foul solution which is then slurped back up using the wavekin's straw-like tongue.

name: Aphotic Pirarucu
textHtml: Unlike euphotic pirarucu which remain near the surface, these wavekin, for some reason, chose to ignore their species' natural attraction to the light and instead remain and feed on the sediment that collects in deep water. The high mineral content of this sediment results in rock-like scales unseen on the aphotic pirarucu's cousins.
textClean: Unlike euphotic pirarucu which remain near the surface, these wavekin, for some reason, chose to ignore their species' natural attraction to the light and instead remain and feed on the sediment that collects in deep water. The high mineral content of this sediment results in rock-like scales unseen on the aphotic pirarucu's cousins.

name: Hailfinder
textHtml: Similar to its smaller rime eater cousins, the hailfinder is also known for its appetite for glacier cores. So efficient is the creature at absorbing the extreme cold emitted by its prey, that research was conducted by the Heavens' Ward into determining if they might be used to counter Shiva's subzero sorceries during skirmishes with the primal.
textClean: Similar to its smaller rime eater cousins, the hailfinder is also known for its appetite for glacier cores. name: Flarefish
textHtml: Believed to be the sole reason the unfrozen pond remains free of ice, in order to partake in the warmth emitted by the flarefish's sanguine humours, other fish will form schools (at a distance), surrounding the specimen in a barrier which effectively provides protection from larger predators.
textClean: Believed to be the sole reason the unfrozen pond remains free of ice, in order to partake in the warmth emitted by the flarefish's sanguine humours, other fish will form schools (at a distance), surrounding the specimen in a barrier which effectively provides protection from larger predators.

name: Twin-tongued Carp
textHtml: With three lips and two tongues, this rare carp has enough internal and external appendages to render any respectable ichthyologist flummoxed.
textClean: With three lips and two tongues, this rare carp has enough internal and external appendages to render any respectable ichthyologist flummoxed.

name: Madam Butterfly
textHtml: There is the sad tale of a pair of butterfly fish kept by a Sharlayan sophist. When preparations for the great exodus back to the Old World were being made, the sophist's manservant separated the two fish to prevent scale damage in transit. An error in packing, however, saw one of the fish─the female─left behind. Madam has since lived her life in sadness awaiting her husband's return.
textClean: There is the sad tale of a pair of butterfly fish kept by a Sharlayan sophist. When preparations for the great exodus back to the Old World were being made, the sophist's manservant separated the two fish to prevent scale damage in transit. An error in packing, however, saw one of the fish─the female─left behind. Madam has since lived her life in sadness awaiting her husband's return.

name: Moggle Mogpom
textHtml: Considerably larger than most mogpoms, the moggle mogpom is believed not only to be the discarded pom of a fallen comrade, but the pom of legendary Moghome chieftain, Moggle Mog.
textClean: Considerably larger than most mogpoms, the moggle mogpom is believed not only to be the discarded pom of a fallen comrade, but the pom of legendary Moghome chieftain, Moggle Mog.

name: Cirrostratus
textHtml: Named for the thin summertime clouds it resembles, the cirrostratus is believed to achieve flight despite its enormous size due to its parchment-like membranous “wings.”
textClean: Named for the thin summertime clouds it resembles, the cirrostratus is believed to achieve flight despite its enormous size due to its parchment-like membranous “wings.”

name: Hraesvelgr's Tear
textHtml: The pristine glass shell encompassing this remarkable magma-dwelling creature is regarded amongst vivarists as to be the Twelve's most beautiful creation, and therefore is highly sought within collectors' circles.
textClean: The pristine glass shell encompassing this remarkable magma-dwelling creature is regarded amongst vivarists as to be the Twelve's most beautiful creation, and therefore is highly sought within collectors' circles.

name: Aetherochemical Compound #666
textHtml: When a specimen of what, at the time, was thought to be compound #123 began sprouting tiny...decidedly Lalafellin...hands, no fewer than three Sons of Saint Coinach naturalists turned in their resignations with the organization and have since disappeared from the public eye.
textClean: When a specimen of what, at the time, was thought to be compound #123 began sprouting tiny...decidedly Lalafellin...hands, no fewer than three Sons of Saint Coinach naturalists turned in their resignations with the organization and have since disappeared from the public eye.

name: Hundred-eyed Axolotl
textHtml: A rare mutation of the tiny axolotl, the countless spots covering this peculiar wavekin's moist skin serve as a defense mechanism, frightening would-be predators into thinking they are being watched by a hundred eyes.
textClean: A rare mutation of the tiny axolotl, the countless spots covering this peculiar wavekin's moist skin serve as a defense mechanism, frightening would-be predators into thinking they are being watched by a hundred eyes.

name: Bobgoblin Bass
textHtml: The one fish that has long eluded renowned Illuminati angler Quickthinx Allthoughts, the bobgoblin bass earns its name from the queer bobbing motion it oft employs to, in Quickthinx's words, “taunt his would-be pursuers.”
textClean: The one fish that has long eluded renowned Illuminati angler Quickthinx Allthoughts, the bobgoblin bass earns its name from the queer bobbing motion it oft employs to, in Quickthinx's words, “taunt his would-be pursuers.”

name: Merciless
textHtml: After a three-bell ale-fueled diatribe regarding one man's futile quest to capture the elusive Merciless─a mercy staff fattened to epic proportions─the proprietor of the tavern in which the forlorn fisher oft frequented closed the man's tab, telling him, “let it all go.”
textClean: After a three-bell ale-fueled diatribe regarding one man's futile quest to capture the elusive Merciless─a mercy staff fattened to epic proportions─the proprietor of the tavern in which the forlorn fisher oft frequented closed the man's tab, telling him, “let it all go.”

name: Dimorphodon
textHtml: Do not be fooled by its size. The dimorphodon may be five to seven times smaller than its wyvern cousins, but its temperament is twice as foul, and its appetite four times as large.* *All values listed here have no basis in scientific fact.
textClean:
Do not be fooled by its size. The dimorphodon may be five to seven times smaller than its wyvern cousins, but its temperament is twice as foul, and its appetite four times as large.*

*All values listed here have no basis in scientific fact.

name: Basking Shark
textHtml: The massive maw of this rarely seen colossus of the clouds is thought to serve two distinct purposes─one, to devour entire coveys of prey in a single gulp, and two, to dramatically increase air resistance allowing for near instant aerial stops and turns.
textClean: The massive maw of this rarely seen colossus of the clouds is thought to serve two distinct purposes─one, to devour entire coveys of prey in a single gulp, and two, to dramatically increase air resistance allowing for near instant aerial stops and turns.

name: Allagan Bladeshark
textHtml: Military documents retrieved from Azys Lla reveal that the bladeshark is a chimerical monstrosity created to serve as a biological weapon. The rapid vibrations exhibited in the creature's unnaturally elongated mouth is a trait artificially induced by scientists to increase the tearing power of its razor-sharp teeth.
textClean: Military documents retrieved from Azys Lla reveal that the bladeshark is a chimerical monstrosity created to serve as a biological weapon. The rapid vibrations exhibited in the creature's unnaturally elongated mouth is a trait artificially induced by scientists to increase the tearing power of its razor-sharp teeth.

name: Bishopfish
textHtml: The divine radiance emitted by the bishopfish's cranial proboscis is like to dazzle many a smaller fry into literally “giving its life” for the cloth.
textClean: The divine radiance emitted by the bishopfish's cranial proboscis is like to dazzle many a smaller fry into literally “giving its life” for the cloth.

name: Captain Nemo
textHtml: Named after a legendary inventor and sea captain who claimed to have traveled to the bottom of the Indigo Deep in a watertight galley hull, this overgrown ammonite uses aether-charged tentacles to deftly slice prey into pieces small enough to fit in its surprisingly tiny mouth.
textClean: Named after a legendary inventor and sea captain who claimed to have traveled to the bottom of the Indigo Deep in a watertight galley hull, this overgrown ammonite uses aether-charged tentacles to deftly slice prey into pieces small enough to fit in its surprisingly tiny mouth.

name: Paikiller
textHtml: Already in shock from the discovery of a freshwater pike that consumes gaelicats, the scientific community was far from prepared for the subsequent discovery of a pike that prefers paissa. As was the case with the “catkiller,” naturalists insisted on keeping the name as short as possible, and thus settled on “paikiller,” despite complaints that it too closely resembled the word “painkiller.”
textClean: Already in shock from the discovery of a freshwater pike that consumes gaelicats, the scientific community was far from prepared for the subsequent discovery of a pike that prefers paissa. name: Ceti
textHtml: Modern naturalist circles were positively abuzz following the discovery of an Allagan tomestone which contained an article on an oliphant's trunk with a maw so sensitive, that it was believed the wavekin could detect activity in the very heavens. Further study of the work however led to the conclusion that the piece was satire.
textClean: Modern naturalist circles were positively abuzz following the discovery of an Allagan tomestone which contained an article on an oliphant's trunk with a maw so sensitive, that it was believed the wavekin could detect activity in the very heavens. Further study of the work however led to the conclusion that the piece was satire.

name: Crystal Pigeon
textHtml: While much of the information gathered from the Habisphere's talkative nodes is limited to occupancy numbers and repair reports, one audio record concerning an elite marksmen's club's afternoon of sniping genetically enhanced stupendemys for sport gives us a rare glimpse into Allagan everyday life.
textClean: While much of the information gathered from the Habisphere's talkative nodes is limited to occupancy numbers and repair reports, one audio record concerning an elite marksmen's club's afternoon of sniping genetically enhanced stupendemys for sport gives us a rare glimpse into Allagan everyday life.

name: Thunderscale
textHtml: Having no other explanation as to why this lone amber salamander would exhibit the ability to emit electric shocks from its skin, the fisher who first discovered this unique wavekin simply assumed that it was because it fed upon the shed scales of a thunder dragon. As of this writing, no one has been able to confirm or deny her claim.
textClean: Having no other explanation as to why this lone amber salamander would exhibit the ability to emit electric shocks from its skin, the fisher who first discovered this unique wavekin simply assumed that it was because it fed upon the shed scales of a thunder dragon. As of this writing, no one has been able to confirm or deny her claim.

name: Riddle
textHtml: While the riddle from which this aged magma louse earns its name is far from what anyone would deem clever─“what lives in molten rock, yet moves less than a corpse?”─it is fairly accurate in describing the vilekin's two main characteristics.
textClean: While the riddle from which this aged magma louse earns its name is far from what anyone would deem clever─“what lives in molten rock, yet moves less than a corpse?”─it is fairly accurate in describing the vilekin's two main characteristics.

name: The Lord of Lords
textHtml: Those naturalists who have placed aside their doubts and come to accept the existence of the fantastical magma-dwelling lavalords have, in their research, discovered the wavekin possess a violent “lord-eat-lord” societal hierarchy, and that rampant cannibalism appears to be the reason only a single male is ever found in a lava pool.
textClean: Those naturalists who have placed aside their doubts and come to accept the existence of the fantastical magma-dwelling lavalords have, in their research, discovered the wavekin possess a violent “lord-eat-lord” societal hierarchy, and that rampant cannibalism appears to be the reason only a single male is ever found in a lava pool.

name: The Speaker
textHtml: The first fisher to supposedly ever have caught the Speaker claims that upon drawing it into his net, the wavekin spoke to him in an oddly ranine voice─pleading to release him back into the waters that he may return to his loving wife and spawn. Thinking it some sort of sign from the Twelve, the fisher did as he was told, only to be rewarded with a croaking cackle and a slap of water in his face.
textClean: The first fisher to supposedly ever have caught the Speaker claims that upon drawing it into his net, the wavekin spoke to him in an oddly ranine voice─pleading to release him back into the waters that he may return to his loving wife and spawn. Thinking it some sort of sign from the Twelve, the fisher did as he was told, only to be rewarded with a croaking cackle and a slap of water in his face.

name: Thousand Fin
textHtml: While “one thousand” may be a gross overstatement regarding the number of tiny fins that circle this queer wavekin's head, for the moogles who are known to utterly despise the hundred fin, achieving numerical accuracy is not a high priority in the event one is encountered in the wild.
textClean: While “one thousand” may be a gross overstatement regarding the number of tiny fins that circle this queer wavekin's head, for the moogles who are known to utterly despise the hundred fin, achieving numerical accuracy is not a high priority in the event one is encountered in the wild.

name: Bloodchaser
textHtml: This peculiar storm chaser exhibits fins that are a deep crimson, hence the colorful name. Despite local Vanu Vanu legend which claims the contrary, Bloodchaser does not appear to drain the humours of its victims, but feeds just as any other storm chaser─digesting prey in its stomach to produce gas that it emits from its rectum to achieve propulsion. Yes, you read that correctly.

Yes, you read that correctly.

name: Problematicus
textHtml: When this particular specimen was presented at a naturalist symposium for classification, the day ended in a flurry of fisticuffs following a heated argument over whether it was not merely a fake stitched together in a cluttered study. The following day the claims were voted baseless and the wavekin received its new official name.
textClean: When this particular specimen was presented at a naturalist symposium for classification, the day ended in a flurry of fisticuffs following a heated argument over whether it was not merely a fake stitched together in a cluttered study. The following day the claims were voted baseless and the wavekin received its new official name.

name: Opabinia
textHtml: One can only imagine the manner of twisted carnal desires which drove the Allagan bioengineer who created this five-eyed, tentacled monstrosity.
textClean: One can only imagine the manner of twisted carnal desires which drove the Allagan bioengineer who created this five-eyed, tentacled monstrosity.

name: Armor Fish
textHtml: Many graduates of new Sharlayan's universities look back on their education with great fondness, reminiscing of days past with tales of studying for exams into the small hours, their rooms lit with naught but the faint glow emitted by armor fish caught in the Thaliak River.
textClean: Many graduates of new Sharlayan's universities look back on their education with great fondness, reminiscing of days past with tales of studying for exams into the small hours, their rooms lit with naught but the faint glow emitted by armor fish caught in the Thaliak River.

name: Sea Butterfly
textHtml: Lighter than the seed of a dandelion, the sea butterfly flitters about the Sea of Clouds searching for the tiny midges upon which it feeds. So rare are these mollusks that seeing one is widely believed to bring good fortune.
textClean: Lighter than the seed of a dandelion, the sea butterfly flitters about the Sea of Clouds searching for the tiny midges upon which it feeds. So rare are these mollusks that seeing one is widely believed to bring good fortune.

name: Charibenet
textHtml: After witnessing the voracity with which it devoured its kin, it almost seemed wrong not to name this gluttonous ice faerie after the Holy See's infamous First Inquisitor.
textClean: After witnessing the voracity with which it devoured its kin, it almost seemed wrong not to name this gluttonous ice faerie after the Holy See's infamous First Inquisitor.

name: Raimdellopterus
textHtml: Also known as the “king of the wyverns,” the raimdellopterus was given its official name in honor of the bicentennial of Frandelont Raimdelle's masterwork, the Raimdelle Codex.
textClean: Also known as the “king of the wyverns,” the raimdellopterus was given its official name in honor of the bicentennial of Frandelont Raimdelle's masterwork, the Raimdelle Codex.

name: Thavnairian Leaf
textHtml: The colorful patterns which cover the Thavnairian leaf's body make it a popular addition to aquariums. Once almost impossible to acquire on mainland Eorzea, the Near Eastern native's recent introduction to the Thaliak River has seen its asking price drop from “wholly ludicrous” to “somewhat absurd.”
textClean: The colorful patterns which cover the Thavnairian leaf's body make it a popular addition to aquariums. Once almost impossible to acquire on mainland Eorzea, the Near Eastern native's recent introduction to the Thaliak River has seen its asking price drop from “wholly ludicrous” to “somewhat absurd.”

name: Ghost Faerie
textHtml: In contrast to ice faeries which, while possessing transparent bodies, still display coloring in their internal organs, ghost faeries are entirely without pigment, making them almost impossible to see in the pristine waters of their natural habitat─Clearpool.
textClean: In contrast to ice faeries which, while possessing transparent bodies, still display coloring in their internal organs, ghost faeries are entirely without pigment, making them almost impossible to see in the pristine waters of their natural habitat─Clearpool.

name: Red Sky Coral
textHtml: Similar in almost every way to the red coral found in Eorzea's five seas, scholars remain perplexed at just how this particular breed of immobile wavekin came to live in the Sea of Clouds.
textClean: Similar in almost every way to the red coral found in Eorzea's five seas, scholars remain perplexed at just how this particular breed of immobile wavekin came to live in the Sea of Clouds.

name: Lovers' Clam
textHtml: A popular game amongst Eorzean children consists of putting separate halves of lovers' clam shells in two sacks, and having boys draw from one, and girls from the other. The participants then look to see who has the other half of their shell, the resulting pairs being an augury of true love.
textClean: A popular game amongst Eorzean children consists of putting separate halves of lovers' clam shells in two sacks, and having boys draw from one, and girls from the other. The participants then look to see who has the other half of their shell, the resulting pairs being an augury of true love.

name: River Shrimp
textHtml: When asked which decapod crustacean was their favorite supper treat, nine out of ten orphans claimed they preferred freshwater river shrimp to ordinary saltwater shrimp. All nine claimed one was never enough, and that they would always ask for seconds, to which the reply was consistently, “MORE!? YOU WANT MORE!?”
textClean: When asked which decapod crustacean was their favorite supper treat, nine out of ten orphans claimed they preferred freshwater river shrimp to ordinary saltwater shrimp. All nine claimed one was never enough, and that they would always ask for seconds, to which the reply was consistently, “MORE!? YOU WANT MORE!?”

name: Comet Minnow
textHtml: Stargazers tell of a deity's long descent through the night sky to shine amid murky waters, and claim the fires of the heavens still burn upon its scales. Aquaculturists generally espouse cynicism toward such out-of-this-world origin stories.
textClean: Stargazers tell of a deity's long descent through the night sky to shine amid murky waters, and claim the fires of the heavens still burn upon its scales. Aquaculturists generally espouse cynicism toward such out-of-this-world origin stories.

name: Golden Cichlid
textHtml: Cichlids named for the glittering scales unique to adult males, which garner the attention of mates and predators alike. The survival of the species undoubtedly owes more to the subdued, aptly camouflaging blue hue featured by its widows and orphans.
textClean: Cichlids named for the glittering scales unique to adult males, which garner the attention of mates and predators alike. The survival of the species undoubtedly owes more to the subdued, aptly camouflaging blue hue featured by its widows and orphans.

name: Abalathian Bitterling
textHtml: The bitterling's lack of pigmentation is not the result of mutation or albinism, but rather the product of natural selection, as only the fairest among them were able to blend into the riverbed gravel and avoid predation.
textClean: The bitterling's lack of pigmentation is not the result of mutation or albinism, but rather the product of natural selection, as only the fairest among them were able to blend into the riverbed gravel and avoid predation.

name: Idle Goby
textHtml: One would have to wake up pretty early in the morning to out-slack this notoriously lackadaisical loiterer. Its primary hunting technique consists of lying stagnant in the Slow Wash and waiting for its prey to drift up to it.
textClean: One would have to wake up pretty early in the morning to out-slack this notoriously lackadaisical loiterer. Its primary hunting technique consists of lying stagnant in the Slow Wash and waiting for its prey to drift up to it.

name: Steelhead Trout
textHtml: Life carries this fish back-and-forth, swimming down to estuaries when reaching age, then back upstream to spawn, lending its name to widespread, on-the-nose “seasonal rebirth” clichés in Hingan literature.
textClean: Life carries this fish back-and-forth, swimming down to estuaries when reaching age, then back upstream to spawn, lending its name to widespread, on-the-nose “seasonal rebirth” clichés in Hingan literature.

name: Broken Crab
textHtml: Possessed of a shell no living creature could crack, the crab's hubris grew so great as to warrant the notice of Rhalgr, who by His very hand split its shell asunder for eternity, or so it is said.
textClean: Possessed of a shell no living creature could crack, the crab's hubris grew so great as to warrant the notice of Rhalgr, who by His very hand split its shell asunder for eternity, or so it is said.

name: Miounnefish
textHtml: Pipira, indigenous to the Black Shroud, were successfully transplanted into the climes of Gyr Abania, where they bear the name of the guildmaster largely responsible for their change of address.
textClean: Pipira, indigenous to the Black Shroud, were successfully transplanted into the climes of Gyr Abania, where they bear the name of the guildmaster largely responsible for their change of address.

name: Temple Carp
textHtml: Long ago, disciples of the Fist were made to catch these fish by hand as part of their training regimen. The fish remain a testament to the preparedness of the Fist, now loosed in nearby waters to serve as a bulwark against starvation in the case of a siege.
textClean: Long ago, disciples of the Fist were made to catch these fish by hand as part of their training regimen. The fish remain a testament to the preparedness of the Fist, now loosed in nearby waters to serve as a bulwark against starvation in the case of a siege.

name: Balloon Frog
textHtml: Named for the cheek-puffing posture it manifests when threatened, which can be seen as either intimidating or adorable, depending on your position in the food chain.
textClean: Named for the cheek-puffing posture it manifests when threatened, which can be seen as either intimidating or adorable, depending on your position in the food chain.

name: Lantern Marimo
textHtml: Many a monk has reached enlightenment meditating before the faint aura emitted by this illuminating breed.
textClean: Many a monk has reached enlightenment meditating before the faint aura emitted by this illuminating breed.

name: Rapids Jumper
textHtml: This species often fails to live up to the fanfare inferred from its fast-paced, go-against-the-flow name, as the only flow it has to go against is the Slow Wash.
textClean: This species often fails to live up to the fanfare inferred from its fast-paced, go-against-the-flow name, as the only flow it has to go against is the Slow Wash.

name: Adamantite Bichir
textHtml: Clad in hard, interlocking links that resemble a suit of mail more than they do scales, this fish is known to leave a trail of broken muud suud teeth in its wake.
textClean: Clad in hard, interlocking links that resemble a suit of mail more than they do scales, this fish is known to leave a trail of broken muud suud teeth in its wake.

name: Bone Melter
textHtml: Necrophagous whelk that flocks to carcasses en masse, whittling them down to next to nothing. Morbid feeding habits aside, it does have a pretty shell, which hunters carry around for luck.
textClean: Necrophagous whelk that flocks to carcasses en masse, whittling them down to next to nothing. Morbid feeding habits aside, it does have a pretty shell, which hunters carry around for luck.

name: Fallen Leaf
textHtml: If a tree falls in the woods, and there is no one there to see it, do the leaves that fall in water become possessed by migrant spirits and generate a new species of fish?
textClean: If a tree falls in the woods, and there is no one there to see it, do the leaves that fall in water become possessed by migrant spirits and generate a new species of fish?

name: Velodyna Grass Carp
textHtml: Midsized, yet critical, link in the food chain of the river valley from which it borrows its name.
textClean: Midsized, yet critical, link in the food chain of the river valley from which it borrows its name.

name: Highland Perch
textHtml: If you ever wish to see two natural historians at each other's throats, try asking them what the difference between a hinterlands perch and a highland perch is. Wars have been waged over less hotly contested disputes.
textClean: If you ever wish to see two natural historians at each other's throats, try asking them what the difference between a hinterlands perch and a highland perch is. Wars have been waged over less hotly contested disputes.

name: Greenstream Loach
textHtml: There's no prying this intractable flatfish loose once it deploys its ventral fin for suction, and its aptitude for withstanding the most violent of currents has rendered its name synonymous with obstinacy.
textClean: There's no prying this intractable flatfish loose once it deploys its ventral fin for suction, and its aptitude for withstanding the most violent of currents has rendered its name synonymous with obstinacy.

name: Mirage Chub
textHtml: Some might pass this silver fish off as commonplace at first glance, but when the season is right and she dons her ravishing red sash, you can bet they'll take notice. When ready to breed, her unique scale pattern generates a stunning visual effect meant to mesmerize mates and other admirers.
textClean: Some might pass this silver fish off as commonplace at first glance, but when the season is right and she dons her ravishing red sash, you can bet they'll take notice. When ready to breed, her unique scale pattern generates a stunning visual effect meant to mesmerize mates and other admirers.

name: Padjali Loach
textHtml: Its strict algae diet keeps this fish in pristine health, giving it a fresh, delectable flavor that fetches top gil with Gyr Abanian fishmongers and renders it a worthy tribute to the Padjal. This demonstrates that contrary to common perception, a life of healthy eating is not always in a species' best interests.
textClean: Its strict algae diet keeps this fish in pristine health, giving it a fresh, delectable flavor that fetches top gil with Gyr Abanian fishmongers and renders it a worthy tribute to the Padjal. This demonstrates that contrary to common perception, a life of healthy eating is not always in a species' best interests.

name: Gyr Abanian Trout
textHtml: Anyone who's ever been to Gyr Abania is likely to have seen one, and even more likely to have eaten one, as this particular trout is deemed a local specialty.
textClean: Anyone who's ever been to Gyr Abania is likely to have seen one, and even more likely to have eaten one, as this particular trout is deemed a local specialty.

name: Bloodsipper
textHtml: The popular misconception that this sanguine crustacean slices mammals with its claws and partakes of their blood is patently false, but believable enough to have inspired its moniker.
textClean: The popular misconception that this sanguine crustacean slices mammals with its claws and partakes of their blood is patently false, but believable enough to have inspired its moniker.

name: Monk Betta
textHtml: Exhibiting an austere warrior spirit and fierce territorial aggression, violence among fellow fish of the order is often marked by vicious brutality.
textClean: Exhibiting an austere warrior spirit and fierce territorial aggression, violence among fellow fish of the order is often marked by vicious brutality.

name: Gilfish
textHtml: Glamorous per its name, one glint of this fish's ostentatious scales is often enough to invite avaricious wish-chasers to a watery grave.
textClean: Glamorous per its name, one glint of this fish's ostentatious scales is often enough to invite avaricious wish-chasers to a watery grave.

name: Falling Star
textHtml: Denomination for a faintly luminescent subset of algae, their phosphorescent fires allegedly lit long ago by the burning star cast forth by Rhalgr.
textClean: Denomination for a faintly luminescent subset of algae, their phosphorescent fires allegedly lit long ago by the burning star cast forth by Rhalgr.

name: Capsized Squeaker
textHtml: Having the unusual habit of swimming upside down in common suggests some relation between this squeaker and its Dravanian cousin, although the precise distance of said relation is yet to be established.
textClean: Having the unusual habit of swimming upside down in common suggests some relation between this squeaker and its Dravanian cousin, although the precise distance of said relation is yet to be established.

name: Nirvana Crab
textHtml: It is said an underachieving monk achieved enlightenment in a single night. On inspecting his bedchambers, the assembled throng of disciples received the wordless sermon of this crab holding up a white mushroom.
textClean: It is said an underachieving monk achieved enlightenment in a single night. On inspecting his bedchambers, the assembled throng of disciples received the wordless sermon of this crab holding up a white mushroom.

name: Gravel Gudgeon
textHtml: Succulent fish whose only refuge from the talons of griffins lies nestled under the riverbed. Seldom, if ever, has one been spotted with scales intact.
textClean: Succulent fish whose only refuge from the talons of griffins lies nestled under the riverbed. Seldom, if ever, has one been spotted with scales intact.

name: Grinning Anchovy
textHtml: This fowl-mouthed forage fish often plumbs the depths of Hingan cauldrons, its juices boiled out to form the base of beloved broths.
textClean: This fowl-mouthed forage fish often plumbs the depths of Hingan cauldrons, its juices boiled out to form the base of beloved broths.

name: Glass Herring
textHtml: This migratory fish thrives under transparency, unlike its misleading red cousins. Its brine-pickled eggs foreshadow deliciousness.
textClean: This migratory fish thrives under transparency, unlike its misleading red cousins. Its brine-pickled eggs foreshadow deliciousness.

name: Hellyfish
textHtml: Tormented soul that has ventured from the bowels of the underworld through a hellmouth to claim the lives of mortals with its virulent venom. Petting not recommended.
textClean: Tormented soul that has ventured from the bowels of the underworld through a hellmouth to claim the lives of mortals with its virulent venom. Petting not recommended.

name: Ruby Coral
textHtml: More commonly known as “Reef Ruby” or “Peasant Ruby,” you'll find no shortage of this ostensible gemstone polished and set in the trinkets of Hingan traders.
textClean: More commonly known as “Reef Ruby” or “Peasant Ruby,” you'll find no shortage of this ostensible gemstone polished and set in the trinkets of Hingan traders.

name: Sapphire Coral
textHtml: Luckily for the survival of the species, this sapphiric simulant has failed to come in vogue with the Hingan fashion-conscious as has its equally alluring ruby cousin.
textClean: Luckily for the survival of the species, this sapphiric simulant has failed to come in vogue with the Hingan fashion-conscious as has its equally alluring ruby cousin.

name: Bone Coral
textHtml: Virtually indistinguishable from mammalian bones, this coral can cause quite a commotion upon washing ashore, and often engenders a sense of foreboding in sailors of the East.
textClean: Virtually indistinguishable from mammalian bones, this coral can cause quite a commotion upon washing ashore, and often engenders a sense of foreboding in sailors of the East.

name: Ruby Shrimp
textHtml: For all their differences, the people of Othard and Hingashi have always had one thing in common, as these zesty and succulent prawns are loved on all sides of the Ruby Sea.
textClean: For all their differences, the people of Othard and Hingashi have always had one thing in common, as these zesty and succulent prawns are loved on all sides of the Ruby Sea.

name: Coeurl Snake Eel
textHtml: For decades, the taxonomy of this species had been the subject of fierce tripartite debate, driving the aquatic nomenclature community to the brink of schism, until a compromise was reached whereby the creature would simply be known by all three names.
textClean: For decades, the taxonomy of this species had been the subject of fierce tripartite debate, driving the aquatic nomenclature community to the brink of schism, until a compromise was reached whereby the creature would simply be known by all three names.

name: Heather Charr
textHtml: The social struggle for dominance this species encounters in schools is often on display at the base of the waterfall, which the fish treat as a sort of cafeteria. When a water-struck insect falls before them, the fish move quickly to judge it, as if asking “what's your damage?” before descending upon it.
textClean: The social struggle for dominance this species encounters in schools is often on display at the base of the waterfall, which the fish treat as a sort of cafeteria. When a water-struck insect falls before them, the fish move quickly to judge it, as if asking “what's your damage?” before descending upon it.

name: Electric Catfish
textHtml: The unenlightened claim that Rhalgr bestowed the divine might of thunder upon this catfish in recognition of its zealous devotion, but aquariophiles dismiss these silly claims, knowing the breed to be terribly irreverent.
textClean: The unenlightened claim that Rhalgr bestowed the divine might of thunder upon this catfish in recognition of its zealous devotion, but aquariophiles dismiss these silly claims, knowing the breed to be terribly irreverent.

name: Death Loach
textHtml: This fish gives new meaning to “the sweet kiss of death,” as wars have been waged over its delectable flesh, hence its fateful name.
textClean: This fish gives new meaning to “the sweet kiss of death,” as wars have been waged over its delectable flesh, hence its fateful name.

name: Grymm Crab
textHtml: A tragic crab named for a man who nearly perished of thirst while fleeing the floods of the Sixth Umbral Calamity, only to eventually drown guzzling the first fresh water he stumbled upon.
textClean: A tragic crab named for a man who nearly perished of thirst while fleeing the floods of the Sixth Umbral Calamity, only to eventually drown guzzling the first fresh water he stumbled upon.

name: Invisible Crayfish
textHtml: This crawdad is best known to Gyr Abanians via the faerie tale in which its brilliant shell fades with each cycle of the Slow Wash, until only an empty white palette remains.
textClean: This crawdad is best known to Gyr Abanians via the faerie tale in which its brilliant shell fades with each cycle of the Slow Wash, until only an empty white palette remains.

name: Abalathian Salamander
textHtml: Wavekin that plays the runt among its kith. Its rubbery flesh results in an unappetizing texture when cooked, rendering it for all practical purposes inedible.
textClean: Wavekin that plays the runt among its kith. Its rubbery flesh results in an unappetizing texture when cooked, rendering it for all practical purposes inedible.

name: Cave Killifish
textHtml: Rugged little fry with the wherewithal to thrive in even the dankest, darkest subterranean climes, though it is unclear how they ever got there in the first place.
textClean: Rugged little fry with the wherewithal to thrive in even the dankest, darkest subterranean climes, though it is unclear how they ever got there in the first place.

name: Rhalgr's Bolt
textHtml: When this electric eel shocks and awes its prey like a god of thunder, the victim rocks and rolls, and the spell it's under slowly robs it of its soul.
textClean: When this electric eel shocks and awes its prey like a god of thunder, the victim rocks and rolls, and the spell it's under slowly robs it of its soul.

name: Butterfly Fish
textHtml: Though indigenous to southern waters, now and again a papilliferous wanderer will lose its way and flutter mindlessly into the Ruby Sea.
textClean: Though indigenous to southern waters, now and again a papilliferous wanderer will lose its way and flutter mindlessly into the Ruby Sea.

name: Dafu
textHtml: From an ancient Far Eastern term for “genius” or “master of its trade,” its name speaks to the inspiring artistry on display in this magnificent specimen.
textClean: From an ancient Far Eastern term for “genius” or “master of its trade,” its name speaks to the inspiring artistry on display in this magnificent specimen.

name: Leaf Tatsunoko
textHtml: An eccentric protrusion enables this seafarer to evade predators by posing as algae, which it also relies on for cloaking its eggs.
textClean: An eccentric protrusion enables this seafarer to evade predators by posing as algae, which it also relies on for cloaking its eggs.

name: Glass Flounder
textHtml: Flat sheet of a fish that pairs wonderfully with grog when properly stewed. Makes an easier-to-chew entrée than its name might imply.
textClean: Flat sheet of a fish that pairs wonderfully with grog when properly stewed. Makes an easier-to-chew entrée than its name might imply.

name: Gliding Fish
textHtml: Per its name, this nautical drifter skitters gracefully along the water's surface on the lift of its aliform fins, though its hurried scurrying to escape predators occasionally lands it smack onto a fishing boat floor.
textClean: Per its name, this nautical drifter skitters gracefully along the water's surface on the lift of its aliform fins, though its hurried scurrying to escape predators occasionally lands it smack onto a fishing boat floor.

name: Globefish
textHtml: When faced with immediate danger, this fish pulls its best bombfish impression, puffing up its proportions and projecting spines to dissuade would-be diners from digging in.
textClean: When faced with immediate danger, this fish pulls its best bombfish impression, puffing up its proportions and projecting spines to dissuade would-be diners from digging in.

name: Fan Clam
textHtml: Though it maintains an avid following in Isari, the “fan” of this bivalve mollusk's name actually refers to the flabelliform shape of its exoskeleton, as any reasonable person would naturally conclude.
textClean: Though it maintains an avid following in Isari, the “fan” of this bivalve mollusk's name actually refers to the flabelliform shape of its exoskeleton, as any reasonable person would naturally conclude.

name: Striped Fugu
textHtml: Beyond the potentially fatal toxins of its liver and ovaries lies a flavor to die for, as survivors will attest.
textClean: Beyond the potentially fatal toxins of its liver and ovaries lies a flavor to die for, as survivors will attest.

name: Ruby Meagre
textHtml: Don't let the name fool you; this shoal-dweller is anything but meager when it comes to flavor. Delicious any way you slice or cook it, Isari anglers are always on the lookout for what ultimately constitutes a staple of their diet.
textClean: Don't let the name fool you; this shoal-dweller is anything but meager when it comes to flavor. Delicious any way you slice or cook it, Isari anglers are always on the lookout for what ultimately constitutes a staple of their diet.

name: River Barramundi
textHtml: Despite its name, phylogeny suggests that this fish is actually more carp than barramundi, though the herons and other avians that feed off of it don't seem to mind.
textClean: Despite its name, phylogeny suggests that this fish is actually more carp than barramundi, though the herons and other avians that feed off of it don't seem to mind.

name: Nogoi
textHtml: Yanxia has found itself overrun by this species with a formulaic overpopulating blend of longevity and hyperactive libido. The “no” of its name aptly deriving from the Hingan for “wild.”
textClean: Yanxia has found itself overrun by this species with a formulaic overpopulating blend of longevity and hyperactive libido. The “no” of its name aptly deriving from the Hingan for “wild.”

name: Pagan Pirarucu
textHtml: An unorthodox variety of catfish upon which Rhalgr did not see fit to bestow His gift of thunder, hence it has little more than its biting wit with which to fend for itself.
textClean: An unorthodox variety of catfish upon which Rhalgr did not see fit to bestow His gift of thunder, hence it has little more than its biting wit with which to fend for itself.

name: Enid Shrimp
textHtml: Shrimp bearing the name of a woman who perished with her husband Grymm while fleeing the floods of the Sixth Umbral Calamity. It is said she died of drinking too much water while trying to slake an unquenchable thirst.
textClean: Shrimp bearing the name of a woman who perished with her husband Grymm while fleeing the floods of the Sixth Umbral Calamity. It is said she died of drinking too much water while trying to slake an unquenchable thirst.

name: Black Velodyna Carp
textHtml: The rivers of Velodyna and Hathoeva are rife with these hungry natators, whose ebon exterior derives from a dark diet.
textClean: The rivers of Velodyna and Hathoeva are rife with these hungry natators, whose ebon exterior derives from a dark diet.

name: Yanxian Koi
textHtml: The One River is flooded with this species, which is surprisingly nutritious if you can look past its muddy stink and abundance of small sharp bones. Locals are wont to drench it in liquor and sugar and let soak until palatable.
textClean: The One River is flooded with this species, which is surprisingly nutritious if you can look past its muddy stink and abundance of small sharp bones. Locals are wont to drench it in liquor and sugar and let soak until palatable.

name: Longhair Catfish
textHtml: Meandering purposefully along the bed of the One River, this fish's signature whiskers exude an air of solitary sagacity befitting its unofficial “hermitfish” appellation.
textClean: Meandering purposefully along the bed of the One River, this fish's signature whiskers exude an air of solitary sagacity befitting its unofficial “hermitfish” appellation.

name: Doman Trout
textHtml: Run-of-the-mill trout found far and wide across Yanxia. Whoever said cats won't touch them has never owned a Doman cat.
textClean: Run-of-the-mill trout found far and wide across Yanxia. Whoever said cats won't touch them has never owned a Doman cat.

name: Yanxian Barramundi
textHtml: Tall tales abound around the One River, but have you heard the one about the fish bigger than a full-grown Hyur? The ecstasy of reeling in the fabled monster is soon offset by the realization one must then haul it all the way back home.
textClean: Tall tales abound around the One River, but have you heard the one about the fish bigger than a full-grown Hyur? The ecstasy of reeling in the fabled monster is soon offset by the realization one must then haul it all the way back home.

name: Tail Mountains Minnow
textHtml: Who says minnows can't move mountains? The red peaks of their homeland hoisted firmly upon their backs, these little-fish-that-could are quite a sight to see, drawing onlookers from far and wide eager to take a peek.
textClean: Who says minnows can't move mountains? The red peaks of their homeland hoisted firmly upon their backs, these little-fish-that-could are quite a sight to see, drawing onlookers from far and wide eager to take a peek.

name: Killifish
textHtml: These lovable little lads are a regular attraction at the fairs of the Far East. Eager younglings line up to test their skill and take one home, whereupon the fish are free to ravage local fish populations with plague and make good on their name.
textClean: These lovable little lads are a regular attraction at the fairs of the Far East. Eager younglings line up to test their skill and take one home, whereupon the fish are free to ravage local fish populations with plague and make good on their name.

name: Doman Crayfish
textHtml: Head to a countryside creek in Yanxia on a warm summer's day and you'll be sure to see children fishing out these crustacean critters, which are as common as they are harmless.
textClean: Head to a countryside creek in Yanxia on a warm summer's day and you'll be sure to see children fishing out these crustacean critters, which are as common as they are harmless.

name: Othardian Trout
textHtml: A familiar face anywhere you journey on the subcontinent, its ubiquity has led to innumerable interpretations of a multitude of dishes all across Othard. Indeed nowhere is safe for this fish.
textClean: A familiar face anywhere you journey on the subcontinent, its ubiquity has led to innumerable interpretations of a multitude of dishes all across Othard. Indeed nowhere is safe for this fish.

name: Zagas Khaal
textHtml: Ask a nomad of the Azim Steppe to blurt out the first fish that comes to mind, and without fail you will hear the name of this pervasive species, followed by an awkward silence.
textClean: Ask a nomad of the Azim Steppe to blurt out the first fish that comes to mind, and without fail you will hear the name of this pervasive species, followed by an awkward silence.

name: Steppe Skipper
textHtml: This fish's aerodynamic green fins allow it to jump to conclusions rather than go through the motions. The Auri Xaela, who know a thing or two about shortcuts, regard the steppe skipper as a portent of good things to come.
textClean: This fish's aerodynamic green fins allow it to jump to conclusions rather than go through the motions. The Auri Xaela, who know a thing or two about shortcuts, regard the steppe skipper as a portent of good things to come.

name: Sun Bass
textHtml: Azim in the sky is said to partake of this fish fit for a god, though you'll want to think twice before partaking yourself, as the parasites that riddle its body have proven potentially fatal to less-than-divine diners.
textClean: Azim in the sky is said to partake of this fish fit for a god, though you'll want to think twice before partaking yourself, as the parasites that riddle its body have proven potentially fatal to less-than-divine diners.

name: Dawn Crayfish
textHtml: Devoted disciple of the Dawn Father who battles his sworn enemy for control of the Azim Steppe, and rises as his rival sets.
textClean: Devoted disciple of the Dawn Father who battles his sworn enemy for control of the Azim Steppe, and rises as his rival sets.

name: Curtain Pleco
textHtml: Migratory fish with a giant curtain-like dorsal fin, which it lifts to move along until the day it bows out in its final act.
textClean: Migratory fish with a giant curtain-like dorsal fin, which it lifts to move along until the day it bows out in its final act.

name: Yat Goby
textHtml: The winsome-faced bottom-feeder wields its fin with the dexterity of a finger, delicately digging into the riverbed to dine on only the finest sediment.
textClean: The winsome-faced bottom-feeder wields its fin with the dexterity of a finger, delicately digging into the riverbed to dine on only the finest sediment.

name: Nhaama's Boon
textHtml: A fish held in the highest esteem by desert denizens, who deem it a gift from the Dusk Mother herself. It's edible, but far from transcendent.
textClean: A fish held in the highest esteem by desert denizens, who deem it a gift from the Dusk Mother herself. It's edible, but far from transcendent.

name: Doman Eel
textHtml: A stable source of sustenance through times both thick and thin, these eels have had a profound impact on the culinary culture of Doma, but attempts to farm them have thus far met with failure.
textClean: A stable source of sustenance through times both thick and thin, these eels have had a profound impact on the culinary culture of Doma, but attempts to farm them have thus far met with failure.

name: Brassfish
textHtml: Sharing color with the metal alloy of its name, this fish has been chromatically cultivated to achieve a variety of metallic hues, resulting in warehouse-worths of industrial fish.
textClean: Sharing color with the metal alloy of its name, this fish has been chromatically cultivated to achieve a variety of metallic hues, resulting in warehouse-worths of industrial fish.

name: Dry Steppe Skipper
textHtml: Unlike its purportedly “lucky” brethren, encountering this withering-grass-colored variety of steppe skipper is regarded as an omen of ill fortune among nomads. Dry humor is often lost on the superstitious.
textClean: Unlike its purportedly “lucky” brethren, encountering this withering-grass-colored variety of steppe skipper is regarded as an omen of ill fortune among nomads. Dry humor is often lost on the superstitious.

name: Skytear
textHtml: This fish receives its melancholy moniker from the Xaela, its azure hue conjuring the lachrymose image of a heavenly drop into a pool of sorrow.
textClean: This fish receives its melancholy moniker from the Xaela, its azure hue conjuring the lachrymose image of a heavenly drop into a pool of sorrow.

name: Dusk Crayfish
textHtml: Devoted disciple of the Dusk Mother who battles her sworn enemy for control of the Azim Steppe, and waxes as her nemesis wanes.
textClean: Devoted disciple of the Dusk Mother who battles her sworn enemy for control of the Azim Steppe, and waxes as her nemesis wanes.

name: Bowfish
textHtml: Xaela archers often present offerings of this high-strung arciform fish to their gods before venturing forth on the hunt.
textClean: Xaela archers often present offerings of this high-strung arciform fish to their gods before venturing forth on the hunt.

name: Jade Sculpin
textHtml: This celadon swimmer sports a semi-precious shade of green more befitting an amphibian.
textClean: This celadon swimmer sports a semi-precious shade of green more befitting an amphibian.

name: Hardscale
textHtml: Coated with manifold sheets of interlocking polyfibrous scales capable of deflecting high-velocity harpoons, this is a fish that lives up to its name.
textClean: Coated with manifold sheets of interlocking polyfibrous scales capable of deflecting high-velocity harpoons, this is a fish that lives up to its name.

name: Doman Grass Carp
textHtml: Were it not for the work of these diligent custodians, the One River would be awash in waterweeds. Day in and day out, these unsung heroes dutifully embark upon the thankless task of maintaining their ecosystem by devouring mass quantities of unsavory aquatic grass.
textClean: Were it not for the work of these diligent custodians, the One River would be awash in waterweeds. Day in and day out, these unsung heroes dutifully embark upon the thankless task of maintaining their ecosystem by devouring mass quantities of unsavory aquatic grass.

name: Samurai Fish
textHtml: Glaring across a battlefield of blue, the purple-belted combatant hovers unflinching, unyielding about his territory. His stoic features betray no emotion, his mind remains clear as the limpid sea, ready and unhesitant to render his life to defend his honor.
textClean: Glaring across a battlefield of blue, the purple-belted combatant hovers unflinching, unyielding about his territory. His stoic features betray no emotion, his mind remains clear as the limpid sea, ready and unhesitant to render his life to defend his honor.

name: Tao Bitterling
textHtml: Though the breed is generally deemed unfit for consumption, the Mol nevertheless persist in fishing for them per the bidding of their holy men; a case of faith operating contrary to nature's plan.
textClean: Though the breed is generally deemed unfit for consumption, the Mol nevertheless persist in fishing for them per the bidding of their holy men; a case of faith operating contrary to nature's plan.

name: Blank Oscar
textHtml: The finest papermakers of Doma have yet to create a sheet so blindingly white as this species, which has become a symbol of purity customarily present as good luck at local weddings.
textClean: The finest papermakers of Doma have yet to create a sheet so blindingly white as this species, which has become a symbol of purity customarily present as good luck at local weddings.

name: Dragonfish
textHtml: Though oft found in the aquariums of well-to-do merchants who fancy themselves the living incarnations of imperious, fire-breathing serpents, any relationship between this fish and the mystical creature of legend is purely metaphorical.
textClean: Though oft found in the aquariums of well-to-do merchants who fancy themselves the living incarnations of imperious, fire-breathing serpents, any relationship between this fish and the mystical creature of legend is purely metaphorical.

name: Lordly Salmon
textHtml: A favorite of Ganen, the first Doman king. Per the local jus primae piscis practice, the first-caught fish of each season would be the lord's to dine on that night.
textClean: A favorite of Ganen, the first Doman king. Per the local jus primae piscis practice, the first-caught fish of each season would be the lord's to dine on that night.

name: Yellow Prismfish
textHtml: Scales that absorb a citrine pigment in the waters of Prism Lake to glimmer like gold. As for its flavor, one is reminded of the age-old adage “All that glitters isn't food.”
textClean: Scales that absorb a citrine pigment in the waters of Prism Lake to glimmer like gold. As for its flavor, one is reminded of the age-old adage “All that glitters isn't food.”

name: Blue Prismfish
textHtml: Is it a blue carp that came to thrive amid like-colored waters, or a carp that became blue in order to thrive? Whether the trait was inherited or acquired, the distinct azure tint of this species blends perfectly into its native habitat.
textClean: Is it a blue carp that came to thrive amid like-colored waters, or a carp that became blue in order to thrive? Whether the trait was inherited or acquired, the distinct azure tint of this species blends perfectly into its native habitat.

name: Bull's Bite
textHtml: According to the old wives' tale, swaddling Raubahn would bite into big beefy bits of this fish, bones and all, before his milk teeth had grown in. According to the man himself, the tale is wildly apocryphal, but the name stuck nevertheless.
textClean: According to the old wives' tale, swaddling Raubahn would bite into big beefy bits of this fish, bones and all, before his milk teeth had grown in. According to the man himself, the tale is wildly apocryphal, but the name stuck nevertheless.

name: Peeping Pisces
textHtml: The bulging eyes that endow this fish with expanded peripheral vision also give it its voyeuristic moniker and scandalous reputation.
textClean: The bulging eyes that endow this fish with expanded peripheral vision also give it its voyeuristic moniker and scandalous reputation.

name: Gigant Bass
textHtml: Fish known to grow as long as a boastful Gyr Abanian fisherman's arms can stretch.
textClean: Fish known to grow as long as a boastful Gyr Abanian fisherman's arms can stretch.

name: Daio Squid
textHtml: Known to Hingans as the “great king,” this rare kraken maintains a shroud of mystery, only surfacing from deep-sea depths when it truly needs a release.
textClean: Known to Hingans as the “great king,” this rare kraken maintains a shroud of mystery, only surfacing from deep-sea depths when it truly needs a release.

name: Koromo Octopus
textHtml: When a ship draws near, this tiny little sucker billows out like the Hingan garment for which it is named, transmogrifying to mammoth proportions before dragging sailors from their decks to the depths, or so an old sailor sings.
textClean: When a ship draws near, this tiny little sucker billows out like the Hingan garment for which it is named, transmogrifying to mammoth proportions before dragging sailors from their decks to the depths, or so an old sailor sings.

name: Glass Tuna
textHtml: With a taste as smooth and crystal clear as its name, one bite of this tuna will have you half-full of optimism.
textClean: With a taste as smooth and crystal clear as its name, one bite of this tuna will have you half-full of optimism.

name: Raitonfish
textHtml: There's a whale of a tale about a beast of a fish that eluded the grasp of fishers time and again, but couldn't avoid fate when a novice ninja inadvertently cast a Raiton spell down to a random point in the river.
textClean: There's a whale of a tale about a beast of a fish that eluded the grasp of fishers time and again, but couldn't avoid fate when a novice ninja inadvertently cast a Raiton spell down to a random point in the river.

name: Eastern Pike
textHtml: This eastern relative of the northern pike demonstrates the ranged-attack prowess of an Ala Mhigan pikeman upon his prey, when not himself impaled upon a fisher's spear.
textClean: This eastern relative of the northern pike demonstrates the ranged-attack prowess of an Ala Mhigan pikeman upon his prey, when not himself impaled upon a fisher's spear.

name: Rock Saltfish
textHtml: Pity the poor minotaur who had the ill fortune of treading upon this fish's fatal fin, pricked under-hoof with a potent poison that gradually reduced the colossal creature to a mere carcass.
textClean: Pity the poor minotaur who had the ill fortune of treading upon this fish's fatal fin, pricked under-hoof with a potent poison that gradually reduced the colossal creature to a mere carcass.

name: Tawny Wench Shark
textHtml: To spear this shark with a single harpoon is a Kojin rite of passage, a custom lending itself to easy innuendo and foisting an undeservedly tawdry reputation upon the shark.
textClean: To spear this shark with a single harpoon is a Kojin rite of passage, a custom lending itself to easy innuendo and foisting an undeservedly tawdry reputation upon the shark.

name: Zekki Grouper
textHtml: Prized by Hingans for its myriad culinary uses. You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, or sauté it. It's good pan-fried, deep-fried, or stir-fried. There's Zekki skewers, Zekki soup, Zekki stew, Zekki salad, and more, but a true native prefers it raw.
textClean: Prized by Hingans for its myriad culinary uses. You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, or sauté it. It's good pan-fried, deep-fried, or stir-fried. There's Zekki skewers, Zekki soup, Zekki stew, Zekki salad, and more, but a true native prefers it raw.

name: Saltshield Snapper
textHtml: Where freshwater leaves this soft-shelled chelonian exposed, the briny waters of its natural habitat serve to calcify its carapace into an impregnable underwater fortress.
textClean: Where freshwater leaves this soft-shelled chelonian exposed, the briny waters of its natural habitat serve to calcify its carapace into an impregnable underwater fortress.

name: Meditator
textHtml: This fish is in the unique habit of entering a catatonic, simulated death state in order to survive the dry season, appearing not unlike an ascetic deep in meditation.
textClean: This fish is in the unique habit of entering a catatonic, simulated death state in order to survive the dry season, appearing not unlike an ascetic deep in meditation.

name: Stonytongue
textHtml: This hunter's streamlined brow is tailored to nabbing small fry and insects, and casts a striking contrast against the lofty peaks of Gyr Abania it inhabits.
textClean: This hunter's streamlined brow is tailored to nabbing small fry and insects, and casts a striking contrast against the lofty peaks of Gyr Abania it inhabits.

name: Scimitarfish
textHtml: This crescent-bodied fish may resemble a Gyr Abanian blade in shape, but as a weapon is better suited to slapping than slashing.
textClean: This crescent-bodied fish may resemble a Gyr Abanian blade in shape, but as a weapon is better suited to slapping than slashing.

name: Blockhead
textHtml: Clad in the helm and breastplate nature provided it, this hardheaded nautical juggernaut fears nothing in the open sea, and will launch itself headlong at boats that dare cross its path, occasionally capsizing them.
textClean: Clad in the helm and breastplate nature provided it, this hardheaded nautical juggernaut fears nothing in the open sea, and will launch itself headlong at boats that dare cross its path, occasionally capsizing them.

name: Kotsu Zetsu
textHtml: A compound of the Hingashi terms “kotsu,” meaning “bone,” and “zetsu,” meaning “tongue,” referring to the oral harpoon this fish uses to spear its prey. Its tail is known to grow scarlet with age and bloodguilt.
textClean: A compound of the Hingashi terms “kotsu,” meaning “bone,” and “zetsu,” meaning “tongue,” referring to the oral harpoon this fish uses to spear its prey. Its tail is known to grow scarlet with age and bloodguilt.

name: Pandamoth
textHtml: Odd fish that answers the juvenile riddle “What's black and white and ends in a sordid tail?”, its existence stands as a testament to the simultaneous wonder and perversity of nature.
textClean: Odd fish that answers the juvenile riddle “What's black and white and ends in a sordid tail?”, its existence stands as a testament to the simultaneous wonder and perversity of nature.

name: Liopleurodon
textHtml: Occasionally, nature gets it right on the first try, as evidenced by this predator's sustained reign atop the aquatic food chain. Perfectly at home in the bloodstained waters of the Ruby Sea, the voracious hunter has had no particular need to adapt or evolve since antiquity.
textClean: Occasionally, nature gets it right on the first try, as evidenced by this predator's sustained reign atop the aquatic food chain. Perfectly at home in the bloodstained waters of the Ruby Sea, the voracious hunter has had no particular need to adapt or evolve since antiquity.

name: Ala Mhigan Ribbon
textHtml: Underneath the undulating currents she flits and flutters, her elegantly decorated dorsal fin darting and dancing hither and thither as though celebrating a glorious triumph, hence her association with victory in local folklore.
textClean: Underneath the undulating currents she flits and flutters, her elegantly decorated dorsal fin darting and dancing hither and thither as though celebrating a glorious triumph, hence her association with victory in local folklore.

name: Seraphim
textHtml: The lay fish seem to avert their eyes as this heaven-sent beauty floats gracefully among them, purifying the waters with her celestial presence as she swims along.
textClean: The lay fish seem to avert their eyes as this heaven-sent beauty floats gracefully among them, purifying the waters with her celestial presence as she swims along.

name: Blackfin Snake Eel
textHtml: Deep undercover in the seabed, the killer creeps, inching closer and closer to his crustacean mark before lunging with lethal force to shell it alive. Diners had best take caution as well, as the delicate bones that enable his swift, precise movements pose a formidable culinary challenge.
textClean: Deep undercover in the seabed, the killer creeps, inching closer and closer to his crustacean mark before lunging with lethal force to shell it alive. Diners had best take caution as well, as the delicate bones that enable his swift, precise movements pose a formidable culinary challenge.

name: Sweatfish
textHtml: The arduous sister of the seraphim shines the glorious sunlit streaks of her Dawn Father against the ominous night sky of her Dusk Mother, and is said to be birthed from the very beads off their battle-wet brows.
textClean: The arduous sister of the seraphim shines the glorious sunlit streaks of her Dawn Father against the ominous night sky of her Dusk Mother, and is said to be birthed from the very beads off their battle-wet brows.

name: Hak Bitterling
textHtml: This breed indigenous to the streams of the Azim Steppe protects its eggs by laying them into the calcareous shells of freshwater mollusks, endowing the offspring with a distinctly acrid flavor.
textClean: This breed indigenous to the streams of the Azim Steppe protects its eggs by laying them into the calcareous shells of freshwater mollusks, endowing the offspring with a distinctly acrid flavor.

name: Whitehorse
textHtml: Wherever there are damselfish in distress, this gallant champion shall gallop heroically to the rescue. Bred in the harshest saltwater climes, this noble steed is up to the challenge come hells or high-saline water.
textClean: Wherever there are damselfish in distress, this gallant champion shall gallop heroically to the rescue. Bred in the harshest saltwater climes, this noble steed is up to the challenge come hells or high-saline water.

name: Sculptor
textHtml: With its sawlike upper jaw this aquatic artist chisels, scrapes, and carves away at rock salt deposits for days on end, tinkering away at a mysterious form that often bears a curious resemblance to the phoebad.
textClean: With its sawlike upper jaw this aquatic artist chisels, scrapes, and carves away at rock salt deposits for days on end, tinkering away at a mysterious form that often bears a curious resemblance to the phoebad.

name: Pearl-eye
textHtml: Many a diver's gaze has been diverted by the iridescent white orbs that shine forth from this fish's face. The relative safety of its saltwater lake environs has allowed the otherwise conspicuous species to remain as it was ages ago.
textClean: Many a diver's gaze has been diverted by the iridescent white orbs that shine forth from this fish's face. The relative safety of its saltwater lake environs has allowed the otherwise conspicuous species to remain as it was ages ago.

name: Steelshark
textHtml: If ever you need aquariophiles to talk amongst themselves, give them this topic: despite its metallic hue and menacing silhouette, the steelshark is neither steel, nor a shark. Discuss.
textClean: If ever you need aquariophiles to talk amongst themselves, give them this topic: despite its metallic hue and menacing silhouette, the steelshark is neither steel, nor a shark. Discuss.

name: Harutsuge
textHtml: From the Hingan meaning “herald of the spring” denoting the seasonal phenomenon wherein scores upon scores of freshly hatched fry ride the currents en masse from the Ruby Sea out to the Indigo Deep.
textClean: From the Hingan meaning “herald of the spring” denoting the seasonal phenomenon wherein scores upon scores of freshly hatched fry ride the currents en masse from the Ruby Sea out to the Indigo Deep.

name: Silken Koi
textHtml: Robed in luxurious scales radiating with a distinct nacreous sheen, one is tempted to reach out and feel the fabric of its scales, which are disappointingly slimy. Theories abound as to how it ended up in Plum Spring, but none in particular prevail.
textClean: Robed in luxurious scales radiating with a distinct nacreous sheen, one is tempted to reach out and feel the fabric of its scales, which are disappointingly slimy. Theories abound as to how it ended up in Plum Spring, but none in particular prevail.

name: Hanatatsu
