textHtml: Its name comprising the Hingan terms “hana,” meaning nose, and “tatsu,” to stand, the peculiar branchlike protuberance for which this breed has come to be known is believed to be a development to help conceal it within the reef.
textClean: Its name comprising the Hingan terms “hana,” meaning nose, and “tatsu,” to stand, the peculiar branchlike protuberance for which this breed has come to be known is believed to be a development to help conceal it within the reef.

name: Deemster
textHtml: Custom once dictated that in order to call oneself a freelance proper, the sellsword first had to reel in this fish of prodigious proportions.
textClean: Custom once dictated that in order to call oneself a freelance proper, the sellsword first had to reel in this fish of prodigious proportions.

name: Swordfish
textHtml: Fishermen willing to cross blades with this sharp-nosed billfish are in for a scrumptious treat, should they survive the battle.
textClean: Fishermen willing to cross blades with this sharp-nosed billfish are in for a scrumptious treat, should they survive the battle.

name: Plum Gazer
textHtml: Found only in Yanxia's Plum Spring, the locals have predictably dreamt up some self-congratulatory inspirational fiction recounting how the fish was moved to scale mountains in hopes of spying the town's prize blossoms, because what other possible explanation could there be?
textClean: Found only in Yanxia's Plum Spring, the locals have predictably dreamt up some self-congratulatory inspirational fiction recounting how the fish was moved to scale mountains in hopes of spying the town's prize blossoms, because what other possible explanation could there be?

name: Zekki Gator
textHtml: This shark's “gator” misnomer, deriving from its Shishu origins, can be deceptive, but there is no mistaking the bloodthirsty “zekki” element, which essentially equates to “indiscriminate killer” in Hingan.
textClean: This shark's “gator” misnomer, deriving from its Shishu origins, can be deceptive, but there is no mistaking the bloodthirsty “zekki” element, which essentially equates to “indiscriminate killer” in Hingan.

name: Wraithfish
textHtml: Devastated by her husband's infidelities, the fisherman's wife hanged herself one night in the woods, and her visage would come to haunt him each day, upon the face of every fish he caught.
textClean: Devastated by her husband's infidelities, the fisherman's wife hanged herself one night in the woods, and her visage would come to haunt him each day, upon the face of every fish he caught.

name: Castaway Chocobo Chick
textHtml: Though bred specially for traversing the five seas and beyond, this captivating cloudkin slipped away from his stables before his swimming lessons were complete, and as a result, can barely keep upright in water without the aid of his trusty life preserver.
textClean: Though bred specially for traversing the five seas and beyond, this captivating cloudkin slipped away from his stables before his swimming lessons were complete, and as a result, can barely keep upright in water without the aid of his trusty life preserver.

name: Little Perykos
textHtml: Miniature namesake of the sea serpent Llymlaen is said to have loosed upon the world alongside Thalaos, and the diminutive breed is possessed of a temper akin to that of a little Thalaos.
textClean: Miniature namesake of the sea serpent Llymlaen is said to have loosed upon the world alongside Thalaos, and the diminutive breed is possessed of a temper akin to that of a little Thalaos.

name: Gyr Abanian Chub
textHtml: When spawning, the head and tail of the Gyr Abanian chub take on a lustrous hue. It is commonly believed that this change in color drastically improves the fish's otherwise mundane flavor.
textClean: When spawning, the head and tail of the Gyr Abanian chub take on a lustrous hue. It is commonly believed that this change in color drastically improves the fish's otherwise mundane flavor.

name: Coral Horse
textHtml: A close relative of the hanatatsu, this sea horse has a body that almost exactly mimics the appearance of the coral in which it lives. So complete is this disguise, that some liken it to a ninja. Of the sea.
textClean: A close relative of the hanatatsu, this sea horse has a body that almost exactly mimics the appearance of the coral in which it lives. So complete is this disguise, that some liken it to a ninja. Of the sea.

name: Maiden's Heart
textHtml: It is said that this brightly colored marimo is the soul of a fair maid who cast herself into a lake after being publicly spurned by a lover of superior social standing. Those who profess belief in this folktale are oddly unperturbed by the existence of more than one maiden's heart.
textClean: It is said that this brightly colored marimo is the soul of a fair maid who cast herself into a lake after being publicly spurned by a lover of superior social standing. Those who profess belief in this folktale are oddly unperturbed by the existence of more than one maiden's heart.

name: Velodyna Salmon
textHtml: This species of salmon swims in the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers. The people of Gyr Abania mark its journey upstream as a sure sign that the seasons have turned.
textClean: This species of salmon swims in the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers. The people of Gyr Abania mark its journey upstream as a sure sign that the seasons have turned.

name: Purple Buckler
textHtml: Warriors once hunted these snapping turtles to fashion shields from their shells, hence the descriptive name. Others, however, have long valued the creature for the invigorating properties of its flesh, either consumed directly or distilled into a potent tonic.
textClean: Warriors once hunted these snapping turtles to fashion shields from their shells, hence the descriptive name. Others, however, have long valued the creature for the invigorating properties of its flesh, either consumed directly or distilled into a potent tonic.

name: Cardinalfish
textHtml: A freshwater fish, so named for its resemblance to the vestments worn by the cardinals of Ishgard's orthodox faith.
textClean: A freshwater fish, so named for its resemblance to the vestments worn by the cardinals of Ishgard's orthodox faith.

name: Rockfish
textHtml: This fish is covered in lumpy protrusions and attaches itself to riverbeds with a sucker-like abdominal fin. In a somewhat disappointing discovery, naturalists found that the skin of a rockfish is far less rigid than its stony appearance would suggest.
textClean: This fish is covered in lumpy protrusions and attaches itself to riverbeds with a sucker-like abdominal fin. In a somewhat disappointing discovery, naturalists found that the skin of a rockfish is far less rigid than its stony appearance would suggest.

name: Ukiki
textHtml: This variety of Eastern sunfish makes its home in the Ruby Sea. Local fisherfolk named it for its passing resemblance to a floating log, though outsiders struggle to see the similarities.
textClean: This variety of Eastern sunfish makes its home in the Ruby Sea. Local fisherfolk named it for its passing resemblance to a floating log, though outsiders struggle to see the similarities.

name: Violet Prismfish
textHtml: Upon sensing a threat to its safety, this vibrantly colored fish discharges a weak jolt of lightning-aspected energy. Though far from lethal, the sudden shock has caused many an unwary fisherman to inadvertently release his precious catch.
textClean: Upon sensing a threat to its safety, this vibrantly colored fish discharges a weak jolt of lightning-aspected energy. Though far from lethal, the sudden shock has caused many an unwary fisherman to inadvertently release his precious catch.

name: Guppy
textHtml: The rainbow-like shimmer of this freshwater fish is highly prized by aquarium enthusiasts. The name is said to be derived from the Sharlayan naturalist who first discovered it, though references to any scholarly “Guppy” have never been officially confirmed.
textClean: The rainbow-like shimmer of this freshwater fish is highly prized by aquarium enthusiasts. The name is said to be derived from the Sharlayan naturalist who first discovered it, though references to any scholarly “Guppy” have never been officially confirmed.

name: Redtail
textHtml: This brightly hued cousin to the common catfish is known for literally biting off far more than it can chew─fishers oft netting weakened or dead specimens having swallowed prey too large for their narrow gullets.
textClean: This brightly hued cousin to the common catfish is known for literally biting off far more than it can chew─fishers oft netting weakened or dead specimens having swallowed prey too large for their narrow gullets.

name: Mirage Mahi
textHtml: With scales that sparkle like solid gold, this distant freshwater relative to the mahi-mahi is sometimes referred to by local fishers as a “river coeurl” due to its voracious appetite and violent temperament.
textClean: With scales that sparkle like solid gold, this distant freshwater relative to the mahi-mahi is sometimes referred to by local fishers as a “river coeurl” due to its voracious appetite and violent temperament.

name: Alligator Snapping Turtle
textHtml: Possibly not fully comprehending the inherent danger in provoking an animal with the words “alligator” and “snapping” in its name, Gyr Abanian freelancers readily partake in a harrowing drinking game that involves downing a flagon of bitter salt ale after poking and prodding one of these ill-tempered turtles' tender noses with their bare hands.
textClean: Possibly not fully comprehending the inherent danger in provoking an animal with the words “alligator” and “snapping” in its name, Gyr Abanian freelancers readily partake in a harrowing drinking game that involves downing a flagon of bitter salt ale after poking and prodding one of these ill-tempered turtles' tender noses with their bare hands.

name: Saltmill
textHtml: Named such for its uncanny ability to break underwater salt formations with its cog-like teeth, this gluttonous specimen feeds on the tiny fish that are left in the wake of its destruction. And while those fry would disagree, salt collectors who work the bleached shores of the Lochs treat saltmill sightings as a symbol of providence.
textClean: Named such for its uncanny ability to break underwater salt formations with its cog-like teeth, this gluttonous specimen feeds on the tiny fish that are left in the wake of its destruction. And while those fry would disagree, salt collectors who work the bleached shores of the Lochs treat saltmill sightings as a symbol of providence.

name: Ribbon Eel
textHtml: Also known as the hanahige (or “flower beard”) eel by fishers of the Ruby Sea, this narrow-bodied wavekin surprisingly begins its life completely black, only taking on the brilliant blues and yellows for which it is revered after reaching adulthood.
textClean: Also known as the hanahige (or “flower beard”) eel by fishers of the Ruby Sea, this narrow-bodied wavekin surprisingly begins its life completely black, only taking on the brilliant blues and yellows for which it is revered after reaching adulthood.

name: Bonsai Fish
textHtml: The bonsai fish's resemblance to a leafy tree branch protects the surface-swimming wavekin from hungry birds looking for their next meal.
textClean: The bonsai fish's resemblance to a leafy tree branch protects the surface-swimming wavekin from hungry birds looking for their next meal.

name: Triplespine
textHtml: With needle-tipped dorsal and ventral fins, and coarse skin reminiscent of rough-spun linen, triplespines have been known to cause irritation in the fishers who make their livelihood handling the unique wavekin.
textClean: With needle-tipped dorsal and ventral fins, and coarse skin reminiscent of rough-spun linen, triplespines have been known to cause irritation in the fishers who make their livelihood handling the unique wavekin.

name: Usuginu Octopus
textHtml: A thin-skinned cousin of the koromo octopus─the name usuginu literally meaning “light cloth”─this majestic cephalopod is favored by Hingan gourmands for its firm, muscular tentacles which are eaten both raw and boiled.
textClean: A thin-skinned cousin of the koromo octopus─the name usuginu literally meaning “light cloth”─this majestic cephalopod is favored by Hingan gourmands for its firm, muscular tentacles which are eaten both raw and boiled.

name: Red Prismfish
textHtml: One of a red prismfish's defense mechanisms includes a slight discharge of bodily heat that will serve to frighten a predator. However, so imbued with the element fire are some of the wavekin that they have been known to boil themselves when tossed in cookpots...or so fishers say.
textClean: One of a red prismfish's defense mechanisms includes a slight discharge of bodily heat that will serve to frighten a predator. However, so imbued with the element fire are some of the wavekin that they have been known to boil themselves when tossed in cookpots...or so fishers say.

name: Elder Gourami
textHtml: Myriad nomad tribes of the Azim Steppe have taken to calling this otherwise unremarkable member of the gourami family “elder” for its twin beard-like ventral fins.
textClean: Myriad nomad tribes of the Azim Steppe have taken to calling this otherwise unremarkable member of the gourami family “elder” for its twin beard-like ventral fins.

name: Shrieker
textHtml: Despite its existence being little more than a rumor, nine out of ten sailors will swear (like sailors) on their grandmothers' graves that the fabled shrieker is nearly identical in appearance to the almost-as-fabled Olgoi-Khorkhoi.
textClean: Despite its existence being little more than a rumor, nine out of ten sailors will swear (like sailors) on their grandmothers' graves that the fabled shrieker is nearly identical in appearance to the almost-as-fabled Olgoi-Khorkhoi.

name: White Goldfish
textHtml: A life of solitude in the aether-starved depths of Prism Lake has left this miniature carp devoid of both color and aspect.
textClean: A life of solitude in the aether-starved depths of Prism Lake has left this miniature carp devoid of both color and aspect.

name: Firelight Goldfish
textHtml: Though the modifier suggests an aspect to fire, this unique wavekin found only in Prism Lake lacks a definite aetherial charge─a trait that ultimately serves as a death sentence for the short-lived species.
textClean: Though the modifier suggests an aspect to fire, this unique wavekin found only in Prism Lake lacks a definite aetherial charge─a trait that ultimately serves as a death sentence for the short-lived species.

name: Hookstealer
textHtml: Countless are the fishers who have cast their lines hoping to be the first to land this elusive prize─their hooks worn by the wavekin in defiance.
textClean: Countless are the fishers who have cast their lines hoping to be the first to land this elusive prize─their hooks worn by the wavekin in defiance.

name: Sapphire Fan
textHtml: The dorsal fin of this king among killifish is so brilliantly blue that the item was once prized by noblewomen, who would use the appendages as fans at social gatherings...that is until their stench saw them fall out of fashion.
textClean: The dorsal fin of this king among killifish is so brilliantly blue that the item was once prized by noblewomen, who would use the appendages as fans at social gatherings...that is until their stench saw them fall out of fashion.

name: The Archbishop
textHtml: Every time the largest of their school is caught, the cardinalfish hold an underwater conclave to select a new Archbishop. Or so the Vault's pious tell their bastards in the Brume before tucking them into bed.
textClean: Every time the largest of their school is caught, the cardinalfish hold an underwater conclave to select a new Archbishop. Or so the Vault's pious tell their bastards in the Brume before tucking them into bed.

name: Bondsplitter
textHtml: There are those who believe that this enormous Enid shrimp's claws are so powerful that they can sever the very bonds of marriage. Then there are some who simply believe the claws go best with hot clarified butter.
textClean: There are those who believe that this enormous Enid shrimp's claws are so powerful that they can sever the very bonds of marriage. Then there are some who simply believe the claws go best with hot clarified butter.

name: The Undecided
textHtml: Despite extended research into the behavior, scholars have been unable to determine exactly why this peculiar variety of rapids jumper feels inclined to constantly travel up- and downstream, the prevailing hypothesis currently being “just because.”
textClean: Despite extended research into the behavior, scholars have been unable to determine exactly why this peculiar variety of rapids jumper feels inclined to constantly travel up- and downstream, the prevailing hypothesis currently being “just because.”

name: Diamond-eye
textHtml: Countless summers swimming in heavily salinated waters have fostered the growth of salt crystals around the eyes of this near-blind, yet bedazzled wavekin.
textClean: Countless summers swimming in heavily salinated waters have fostered the growth of salt crystals around the eyes of this near-blind, yet bedazzled wavekin.

name: Rising Dragon
textHtml: Domans have long set great store by natural remedies such as infusions made with ground hanatatsu. And as is the case with most of these remedies, the bigger the specimen, the more potent the final product is believed to be─the key word here being “believed.”
textClean: Domans have long set great store by natural remedies such as infusions made with ground hanatatsu. And as is the case with most of these remedies, the bigger the specimen, the more potent the final product is believed to be─the key word here being “believed.”

name: The Gambler
textHtml: Lauded by gourmands as one of the most succulent fish in the world, consumption of this delicacy comes with a risk─the flesh can prove extremely deadly unless prepared in a precise manner. Still, those who have survived claim it was worth the gamble. Those who have died were not available for comment.
textClean: Lauded by gourmands as one of the most succulent fish in the world, consumption of this delicacy comes with a risk─the flesh can prove extremely deadly unless prepared in a precise manner. Still, those who have survived claim it was worth the gamble. Those who have died were not available for comment.

name: The Winter Queen
textHtml: For this ancient harutsuge, spring never comes, and while her brethren follow the warm currents to the Indigo Deep, she remains to rule the Ruby Tide in royal solitude.
textClean: For this ancient harutsuge, spring never comes, and while her brethren follow the warm currents to the Indigo Deep, she remains to rule the Ruby Tide in royal solitude.

name: Rakshasa
textHtml: Every year a handful of foolish youths from Sui–no–Sato will set out into the Ruby Sea in search of Rakshasa─lord of the Zekki gators and one of the fastest predators of the deep─and every year, all fail to return. Though, this year's foolish youths claim they have a good feeling about their chances.
textClean: Every year a handful of foolish youths from Sui–no–Sato will set out into the Ruby Sea in search of Rakshasa─lord of the Zekki gators and one of the fastest predators of the deep─and every year, all fail to return. Though, this year's foolish youths claim they have a good feeling about their chances.

name: Bokuden
textHtml: This wavekin was aptly dubbed Bokuden─wandering swordsman of legend─after a territorial scuffle saw three score samurai fish float to the surface of the waters before Doma Castle.
textClean: This wavekin was aptly dubbed Bokuden─wandering swordsman of legend─after a territorial scuffle saw three score samurai fish float to the surface of the waters before Doma Castle.

name: Hagoromo Koi
textHtml: Legend has that this white-scaled wavekin is an angel who fell in love with a mortal and was transformed into a koi and cast from the heavens by her father as punishment. Correction: was an angel.
textClean: Legend has that this white-scaled wavekin is an angel who fell in love with a mortal and was transformed into a koi and cast from the heavens by her father as punishment. Correction: was an angel.

name: The Word of God
textHtml: The Mol believe they are made to endure divine trials that they must overcome to prove their worth. Catching a blessed Tao bitterling was one of these trials. Seeing as they did not catch it, their god will now punish them.
textClean: The Mol believe they are made to endure divine trials that they must overcome to prove their worth. Catching a blessed Tao bitterling was one of these trials. Seeing as they did not catch it, their god will now punish them.

name: Yat Khan
textHtml: Is there none who would dispute this goby's claim to the rule of Yat Khaal? If you answered “no,” you would be correct.
textClean: Is there none who would dispute this goby's claim to the rule of Yat Khaal? If you answered “no,” you would be correct.

name: Curefish
textHtml: The bones of the curefish─a curious specimen that will often wear the skull of drowned beasts to frighten away predators─are thought to possess curative properties, making them a popular commodity.
textClean: The bones of the curefish─a curious specimen that will often wear the skull of drowned beasts to frighten away predators─are thought to possess curative properties, making them a popular commodity.

name: Lake Sphairai
textHtml: A cousin to the coeurlfish with teeth said to be as sharp as legendary Sphairai; though, it is not recommended to discard of your actual Sphairai should you happen upon one of these wavekin.
textClean: A cousin to the coeurlfish with teeth said to be as sharp as legendary Sphairai; though, it is not recommended to discard of your actual Sphairai should you happen upon one of these wavekin.

name: Warmscale Pleco
textHtml: The ability to manipulate fire aether allows this wavekin to heat its dorsal fin which, in turn, warms the surrounding waters, enabling it to survive even the coldest of climes. The fin will exhibit these qualities for moons after being removed from the fish.
textClean: The ability to manipulate fire aether allows this wavekin to heat its dorsal fin which, in turn, warms the surrounding waters, enabling it to survive even the coldest of climes. The fin will exhibit these qualities for moons after being removed from the fish.

name: Shirogane Clam
textHtml: Not only does this mollusk produce invaluable pearls, but its shells are treasured by goldsmiths across Hingashi for their unmatched luster.
textClean: Not only does this mollusk produce invaluable pearls, but its shells are treasured by goldsmiths across Hingashi for their unmatched luster.

name: Illuminati Mask
textHtml: This rare cephalopod, loosely related to the goblin's mask, not only has skin with a bluish tinge, but will blind its enemies with a blast of indigo ink, making it difficult for fishers not to call it by its current colorful name.
textClean: This rare cephalopod, loosely related to the goblin's mask, not only has skin with a bluish tinge, but will blind its enemies with a blast of indigo ink, making it difficult for fishers not to call it by its current colorful name.

name: Indigo Prismfish
textHtml: The mysterious dark hues of this wavekin are only achieved through the rare mating of a violet and a blue prismfish, making the specimens highly sought-after.
textClean: The mysterious dark hues of this wavekin are only achieved through the rare mating of a violet and a blue prismfish, making the specimens highly sought-after.

name: Green Prismfish
textHtml: An overabundance of wind-aspected aether stored within this bloated carp's body provides the wavekin with a weapon to neutralize its prey of choice─namely winged insects and small birds that come down from the safety of the skies to drink.
textClean: An overabundance of wind-aspected aether stored within this bloated carp's body provides the wavekin with a weapon to neutralize its prey of choice─namely winged insects and small birds that come down from the safety of the skies to drink.

name: Watcher Catfish
textHtml: Named after renowned monk Widargelt the Watcher, this electric catfish is capable of releasing a concentrated burst of lightning-aspected aether from its body powerful enough to stun prey up to three times its size.
textClean: Named after renowned monk Widargelt the Watcher, this electric catfish is capable of releasing a concentrated burst of lightning-aspected aether from its body powerful enough to stun prey up to three times its size.

name: Bloodtail Zombie
textHtml: Local fisher legend has that this catfish died choking on a meal too large to slide down its gullet...only to return to the river of its unholy spawning to feed on the brains of lesser fries.
textClean: Local fisher legend has that this catfish died choking on a meal too large to slide down its gullet...only to return to the river of its unholy spawning to feed on the brains of lesser fries.

name: Hardhead Trout
textHtml: If fishers are to be believed (and they are not), this elder steelhead has a knob as hard as Garlean cermet─a deadly weapon it wields to pummel senseless would-be competitors come mating season.
textClean: If fishers are to be believed (and they are not), this elder steelhead has a knob as hard as Garlean cermet─a deadly weapon it wields to pummel senseless would-be competitors come mating season.

name: Downstream Loach
textHtml: This giant loach will use its powerful fins to propel itself to the top of low waterfalls where it will lie in wait, fighting against the current, until it spots suitable prey in the pool below. Once its sights have been set, the loach will leap off the edge and subdue its prey from above.
textClean: This giant loach will use its powerful fins to propel itself to the top of low waterfalls where it will lie in wait, fighting against the current, until it spots suitable prey in the pool below. Once its sights have been set, the loach will leap off the edge and subdue its prey from above.

name: Corpse Chub
textHtml: The ruthlessness this wavekin has shown hoarding a lake's prey to the point of starving all other chubs in the area has earned it rightful comparisons to Thanalan's infamous Corpse Brigade.
textClean: The ruthlessness this wavekin has shown hoarding a lake's prey to the point of starving all other chubs in the area has earned it rightful comparisons to Thanalan's infamous Corpse Brigade.

name: The Last Tear
textHtml: It is said that this Abalathian salamander achieved such prodigious girth by lapping up the tears shed by the countless mourners to have visited the lichyard at Hidden Tear since the Calamity.
textClean: It is said that this Abalathian salamander achieved such prodigious girth by lapping up the tears shed by the countless mourners to have visited the lichyard at Hidden Tear since the Calamity.

name: Hemon
textHtml: A pair of large bulging eyes have earned this wavekin the unfortunate moniker Hemon─the same name as an infamous Peeping Tom who was executed after being caught spying on the mad king Theodoric's wife as she soaked in her chambers.
textClean: A pair of large bulging eyes have earned this wavekin the unfortunate moniker Hemon─the same name as an infamous Peeping Tom who was executed after being caught spying on the mad king Theodoric's wife as she soaked in her chambers.

name: Moksha
textHtml: Fisher monks of the Gyr Abanian Peaks claim this wavekin escaped death during the Calamity by entering a deep meditative state. Five summers later, upon attaining true enlightenment, the meditator awoke, and now swims the highland waters once more.
textClean: Fisher monks of the Gyr Abanian Peaks claim this wavekin escaped death during the Calamity by entering a deep meditative state. Five summers later, upon attaining true enlightenment, the meditator awoke, and now swims the highland waters once more.

name: Princess Killifish
textHtml: Only one in every thousand thousand killifish are born with a light golden hue for which collectors will literally commit regicide...or at least abduction.
textClean: Only one in every thousand thousand killifish are born with a light golden hue for which collectors will literally commit regicide...or at least abduction.

name: Ku'er
textHtml: A bastardization of the Eorzean word “coeurl,” this uniquely patterned wavekin's name was given by Doman fishers who had read of the legendary leonine beasts of the Far West in poorly translated copies of Gridania's foremost publication, The Raven.
textClean: A bastardization of the Eorzean word “coeurl,” this uniquely patterned wavekin's name was given by Doman fishers who had read of the legendary leonine beasts of the Far West in poorly translated copies of Gridania's foremost publication, The Raven.

name: Argonautica
textHtml: As most of the sumptuous wavekin are snatched up by Far Eastern fishers, rarely does a snake eel reach the size of this monstrous serpent.
textClean: As most of the sumptuous wavekin are snatched up by Far Eastern fishers, rarely does a snake eel reach the size of this monstrous serpent.

name: Hagoromo Bijin
textHtml: The billowing fins of this Far Eastern seraphim are oft compared to a kimono featured in a famous painting of a legendary angelic being.
textClean: The billowing fins of this Far Eastern seraphim are oft compared to a kimono featured in a famous painting of a legendary angelic being.

name: Duskfish
textHtml: Xaela legend has that this massive wavekin was born from a scale shed by the Dawn Father. Scholars insist it has simply had the good fortune not to be eaten.
textClean: Xaela legend has that this massive wavekin was born from a scale shed by the Dawn Father. Scholars insist it has simply had the good fortune not to be eaten.

name: Blade Skipper
textHtml: Several of the Azim Steppe's nomadic tribes believe this blood skipper, native to the One River, leapt from the depths of its Yanxian home and rode the thick blades of lush Steppe grass all the way north and east to the upper Yat Khaal where it now dwells.
textClean: Several of the Azim Steppe's nomadic tribes believe this blood skipper, native to the One River, leapt from the depths of its Yanxian home and rode the thick blades of lush Steppe grass all the way north and east to the upper Yat Khaal where it now dwells.

name: Lily of the Veil
textHtml: The eccentricities of noblewomen in pre-occupation Gyr Abania knew no bounds, one such involving the overgrown dorsal fins of Ala Mhigan ribbons which were worn as veils at various social functions. To which, the fish eventually earned the moniker Lily of the Veil─a play on words the ladies surely believed droll.
textClean: The eccentricities of noblewomen in pre-occupation Gyr Abania knew no bounds, one such involving the overgrown dorsal fins of Ala Mhigan ribbons which were worn as veils at various social functions. To which, the fish eventually earned the moniker Lily of the Veil─a play on words the ladies surely believed droll.

name: The Vegetarian
textHtml: Covered in both bone-hard scales and countless deadly spikes─spikes which, upon close inspection, appear to be covered in spikes of their own─this slightly bioluminescent specimen is a king among liopleurodons, and lord of the waters near Hells' Lid.
textClean: Covered in both bone-hard scales and countless deadly spikes─spikes which, upon close inspection, appear to be covered in spikes of their own─this slightly bioluminescent specimen is a king among liopleurodons, and lord of the waters near Hells' Lid.

name: Seven Stars
textHtml: Like stars in the night sky, the maw of this tawny wench shark is pocked with scars left by the myriad attempts of lesser fishers to claim this lofty prize.
textClean: Like stars in the night sky, the maw of this tawny wench shark is pocked with scars left by the myriad attempts of lesser fishers to claim this lofty prize.

name: Pinhead
textHtml: The ladies-in-waiting who serve the Ruby Princess are said to weave their ruler's silken gowns with the spines of this deadly globefish known to stalk its victims to the Seventh Hell.
textClean: The ladies-in-waiting who serve the Ruby Princess are said to weave their ruler's silken gowns with the spines of this deadly globefish known to stalk its victims to the Seventh Hell.

name: Pomegranate Trout
textHtml: It is said that the jewel-like roe of this rare Doman trout has spawned a thousand wars─the blood of those who would fight and die to acquire such a delicacy proving the only thing redder than the eggs themselves.
textClean: It is said that the jewel-like roe of this rare Doman trout has spawned a thousand wars─the blood of those who would fight and die to acquire such a delicacy proving the only thing redder than the eggs themselves.

name: Glarramundi
textHtml: Eastern fishers will swear that the demon-like eyes of this unique river barramundi will follow you, no matter where you stand. More than one charlatan has sought to profit off this phenomenon, harvesting the eyes from fish markets and selling them to Eorzean alchemists under the guise of “voidsent optics.”
textClean: Eastern fishers will swear that the demon-like eyes of this unique river barramundi will follow you, no matter where you stand. name: Hermit's End
textHtml: Residents of the Doman mountain village of Namai claim this plump nogoi to be a hermit who, having grown weary of the monotony of his life, transformed himself into a fish, that he might pass his remaining years without care for the burdens of mankind.
textClean: Residents of the Doman mountain village of Namai claim this plump nogoi to be a hermit who, having grown weary of the monotony of his life, transformed himself into a fish, that he might pass his remaining years without care for the burdens of mankind.

name: Suiten Ippeki
textHtml: Meaning the “deep blue of sea and sky,” its name was coined by a poet who once viewed the brilliant salmon swimming the crystal-clear waters of the One River and claimed it was as if the very heavens had descended from above.
textClean: Meaning the “deep blue of sea and sky,” its name was coined by a poet who once viewed the brilliant salmon swimming the crystal-clear waters of the One River and claimed it was as if the very heavens had descended from above.

name: Axelrod
textHtml: Most would have you believe that this overlarge Yanxian barramundi was named after local smallfolk witnessed the wavekin attempt to swallow the axel of a Kojin's barrow that had fallen into the One River. The truth of the matter is that it was not the barrow that fell into the river, but the Kojin himself...who just so happened to be named Axelrod.
textClean: Most would have you believe that this overlarge Yanxian barramundi was named after local smallfolk witnessed the wavekin attempt to swallow the axel of a Kojin's barrow that had fallen into the One River. The truth of the matter is that it was not the barrow that fell into the river, but the Kojin himself...who just so happened to be named Axelrod.

name: The Unraveled Bow
textHtml: Legend states that, arrested by the sheer brilliance of a rainbow bestraddled athwart Prism Canyon, an angel from on high plucked a band from the bow and whispered unto it the secret of life. The band then slipped from her hand to the water below where it became an eel as green as jade.
textClean: Legend states that, arrested by the sheer brilliance of a rainbow bestraddled athwart Prism Canyon, an angel from on high plucked a band from the bow and whispered unto it the secret of life. The band then slipped from her hand to the water below where it became an eel as green as jade.

name: Nhaama's Treasure
textHtml: Believed by many of the Azim Steppe's Xaela tribes to be a gift from the Dusk Mother herself, this large wavekin is oft presented as a reward in contests of mettle held during sacred festivals.
textClean: Believed by many of the Azim Steppe's Xaela tribes to be a gift from the Dusk Mother herself, this large wavekin is oft presented as a reward in contests of mettle held during sacred festivals.

name: Garden Skipper
textHtml: Some of the Othard's nomadic tribes view this large green skipper as an ill omen that their journey is about to end, and have been known to go as far as abandoning their fishing rods to the river rather than risk reeling one in.
textClean: Some of the Othard's nomadic tribes view this large green skipper as an ill omen that their journey is about to end, and have been known to go as far as abandoning their fishing rods to the river rather than risk reeling one in.

name: Banderole
textHtml: The banderole earns its name from its pinion-like dorsal fin that is so large it is oft mistaken for a Xaelan standard fallen into the khaal.
textClean: The banderole earns its name from its pinion-like dorsal fin that is so large it is oft mistaken for a Xaelan standard fallen into the khaal.

name: Northern Oyster
textHtml: Ishgardians are known to treasure this cold-water shellfish, despite the extreme difficulty both harvesting the wavekin and opening their vice-like shells to retrieve the succulent flesh hidden within. A method of preparation popular amongst the See's nobles involves boiling the oysters to create a thin broth, and then tossing the meat to their hounds.
textClean: Ishgardians are known to treasure this cold-water shellfish, despite the extreme difficulty both harvesting the wavekin and opening their vice-like shells to retrieve the succulent flesh hidden within. A method of preparation popular amongst the See's nobles involves boiling the oysters to create a thin broth, and then tossing the meat to their hounds.

name: Ruby Laver
textHtml: A long-standing staple amongst the costal villages along the Ruby Sea, this nutrient-rich seaweed finds its way into most every dish, from breakfast to supper. It is even added to rice wine to enhance its flavor.
textClean: A long-standing staple amongst the costal villages along the Ruby Sea, this nutrient-rich seaweed finds its way into most every dish, from breakfast to supper. It is even added to rice wine to enhance its flavor.

name: Chakrafish
textHtml: Bemoaning her inability to open even a single chakra, a monk set off into the hills to meditate. For ten days and ten nights did she fast, until on the eleventh day, overcome with hunger, she spied a lone fish in a shallow pond. Unable to control herself, the monk lunged atop the fry and sank her teeth into its sweet, cold flesh...at which time she opened all seven chakra, achieving enlightenment everlasting.
textClean: Bemoaning her inability to open even a single chakra, a monk set off into the hills to meditate. For ten days and ten nights did she fast, until on the eleventh day, overcome with hunger, she spied a lone fish in a shallow pond. Unable to control herself, the monk lunged atop the fry and sank her teeth into its sweet, cold flesh...at which time she opened all seven chakra, achieving enlightenment everlasting.

name: Wicked Wartfish
textHtml: Cursed with a face so ugly, it is said demons of the underworld use the wartfish to frighten souls attempting to escape into returning to hell.
textClean: Cursed with a face so ugly, it is said demons of the underworld use the wartfish to frighten souls attempting to escape into returning to hell.

name: Othardian Salmon
textHtml: The light and flaky flesh of the Othardian salmon pairs well with the aromatic rice wines of Hingashi, making the fish a highly sought-after commodity throughout the realm.
textClean: The light and flaky flesh of the Othardian salmon pairs well with the aromatic rice wines of Hingashi, making the fish a highly sought-after commodity throughout the realm.

name: Warden of the Seven Hues
textHtml: Supposedly spawned white as bone, local legend attributes this uncanny carp's now brilliantly colored scales to extended exposure to the waters of Prism Lake.
textClean: Supposedly spawned white as bone, local legend attributes this uncanny carp's now brilliantly colored scales to extended exposure to the waters of Prism Lake.

name: Xenacanthus
textHtml: Scholars have yet to determine the functionality of the massive spine that protrudes from the specimen's head, reaching back almost to its dorsal fin. Some claim it to be a means of delivering poison to would-be predators, while others suggest it may be an antenna that aids in the location of prey.
textClean: Scholars have yet to determine the functionality of the massive spine that protrudes from the specimen's head, reaching back almost to its dorsal fin. Some claim it to be a means of delivering poison to would-be predators, while others suggest it may be an antenna that aids in the location of prey.

name: Drepanaspis
textHtml: Lack of a fully developed jawbone has forced this fish to find other ways to feed─namely by swallowing up large swaths of seafloor mud to sup on the insignificant species that wriggle and writhe within. As such, the drepanaspis exhibits no interest in normal prey, making it a difficult catch for enterprising fishers.
textClean: Lack of a fully developed jawbone has forced this fish to find other ways to feed─namely by swallowing up large swaths of seafloor mud to sup on the insignificant species that wriggle and writhe within. As such, the drepanaspis exhibits no interest in normal prey, making it a difficult catch for enterprising fishers.

name: Stethacanthus
textHtml: Male stethacanthus vie for reproductive supremacy amongst their species by focusing internal aetherial energy to engender queer saline growths upon their dorsal fins─the size of which is the sole factor in the females' selection of a suitable mate. The crystals can swell to sizes so large that they oft render the wavekin completely motionless.
textClean: Male stethacanthus vie for reproductive supremacy amongst their species by focusing internal aetherial energy to engender queer saline growths upon their dorsal fins─the size of which is the sole factor in the females' selection of a suitable mate. The crystals can swell to sizes so large that they oft render the wavekin completely motionless.

name: The Ruby Dragon
textHtml: Its name known to strike fear into babes and fishers alike, tales of this saltwater legend have been told for nigh on a thousand summers. The most popular telling has that the Ruby Dragon was once a great auspice who willingly succumbed to the aramitama that he might be freed from its burden.
textClean: Its name known to strike fear into babes and fishers alike, tales of this saltwater legend have been told for nigh on a thousand summers. The most popular telling has that the Ruby Dragon was once a great auspice who willingly succumbed to the aramitama that he might be freed from its burden.

name: The Unconditional
textHtml: Possessed of both a dorsal fin not unlike a crescent moon, and a tail fin not unlike the rising sun, this distinctive wavekin is believed by nomads of the Azim Steppe to be the corporeal manifestation of the Dusk Mother and Dawn Father's love for their children on Hydaelyn.
textClean: Possessed of both a dorsal fin not unlike a crescent moon, and a tail fin not unlike the rising sun, this distinctive wavekin is believed by nomads of the Azim Steppe to be the corporeal manifestation of the Dusk Mother and Dawn Father's love for their children on Hydaelyn.

name: Eighteyes Eel
textHtml: The seven sets of small fins arranged along its length were first believed to be eyes, lending this wavekin its name. Its secretions are said to be effective against ocular ailments—it would seem its discoverer did not think to rub their eyes with eel oil before leaping to judgment.
textClean: The seven sets of small fins arranged along its length were first believed to be eyes, lending this wavekin its name. Its secretions are said to be effective against ocular ailments—it would seem its discoverer did not think to rub their eyes with eel oil before leaping to judgment.

name: Crystal Knife
textHtml: This wavekin is named for its resemblance to a blade of sharp, thin crystal─so much so that rumor has it the Crystal Exarch once mistakenly attempted to open his correspondence with one.
textClean: This wavekin is named for its resemblance to a blade of sharp, thin crystal─so much so that rumor has it the Crystal Exarch once mistakenly attempted to open his correspondence with one.

name: Laxan Carp
textHtml: These scaly swimmers were once ten a gil in Lakeland, before being driven to extinction by the Flood. Now they exist only in the experimental breeding beds of the Crystarium.
textClean: These scaly swimmers were once ten a gil in Lakeland, before being driven to extinction by the Flood. Now they exist only in the experimental breeding beds of the Crystarium.

name: Asteroidea
textHtml: These bright blue starfish are used by the educators of the Crystarium to teach children about the stars, leading their nights to be filled with terrors about the wriggling, writhing, five-fingered fiends that lurk unseen in the skies above them.
textClean: These bright blue starfish are used by the educators of the Crystarium to teach children about the stars, leading their nights to be filled with terrors about the wriggling, writhing, five-fingered fiends that lurk unseen in the skies above them.

name: Hard Candy
textHtml: When sea beasts suck these algal organisms into their maws, it looks as if they are sucking on sweets─hence the unusual name. In truth, they are soft, sticky, and taste of seaweed.
textClean: When sea beasts suck these algal organisms into their maws, it looks as if they are sucking on sweets─hence the unusual name. In truth, they are soft, sticky, and taste of seaweed.

name: Abyssal Snail
textHtml: A purple-shelled snail that feeds on the leaves of Lakeland plants. It is named not for any hellish qualities of its own, but after its shell's resemblance to the horns of a legendary demon from the deep.
textClean: A purple-shelled snail that feeds on the leaves of Lakeland plants. It is named not for any hellish qualities of its own, but after its shell's resemblance to the horns of a legendary demon from the deep.

name: Clean Saucer
textHtml: A flat white fish that resembles the spotless crockery of a tea drinker indisposed to spillage. Its underside is a vivid purple─hang around in taverns long enough, and you're bound to hear the tale of how the clean saucer got its bruised bottom sooner or later.
textClean: A flat white fish that resembles the spotless crockery of a tea drinker indisposed to spillage. Its underside is a vivid purple─hang around in taverns long enough, and you're bound to hear the tale of how the clean saucer got its bruised bottom sooner or later.

name: Rabbit Skipper
textHtml: With its white and red eyes, long earlike fins and proclivity for hopping to and fro on the surface of the water, this wavekin would seem to be a rabbit born in the wrong body. Scholars hypothesize that they feed mainly on carrots, but this is as yet unconfirmed.
textClean: With its white and red eyes, long earlike fins and proclivity for hopping to and fro on the surface of the water, this wavekin would seem to be a rabbit born in the wrong body. Scholars hypothesize that they feed mainly on carrots, but this is as yet unconfirmed.

name: Water Ball
textHtml: An albino subspecies of the official balls common to Il Mheg. Scholars believe that the ancestors of these freshwater wavekin were shunned by their brightly colored cousins and fled to Lakeland to begin a new life, free from pigment-based prejudice.
textClean: An albino subspecies of the official balls common to Il Mheg. Scholars believe that the ancestors of these freshwater wavekin were shunned by their brightly colored cousins and fled to Lakeland to begin a new life, free from pigment-based prejudice.

name: Xanthic Bass
textHtml: A wavekin stained a vibrant amber hue from tip to tail. Some say that this curious coloration serves as protection from the blazing rays of the Flood. Those of a more fabulous bent insist that its yellow belly is but a physical manifestation of its cowardly nature.
textClean: A wavekin stained a vibrant amber hue from tip to tail. Some say that this curious coloration serves as protection from the blazing rays of the Flood. Those of a more fabulous bent insist that its yellow belly is but a physical manifestation of its cowardly nature.

name: Albino Garfish
textHtml: These highly territorial wavekin spawn in the seas off the Isle of Ken, tearing into any aquatic creatures fool enough to stray into their waters with rows of razor-sharp teeth. Their dominion over the island's waves has led some fishers to dub them the “Ken Masters.”
textClean: These highly territorial wavekin spawn in the seas off the Isle of Ken, tearing into any aquatic creatures fool enough to stray into their waters with rows of razor-sharp teeth. Their dominion over the island's waves has led some fishers to dub them the “Ken Masters.”

name: Albino Caiman
textHtml: A ferocious hunter that lurks in shallow waters, waiting for its prey to stray too close before it strikes. When its pure white body bursts through the surface of a bloodstained lake, it resembles nothing more than a blob of fresh cream atop a rolanberry coulis. But with more teeth.
textClean: A ferocious hunter that lurks in shallow waters, waiting for its prey to stray too close before it strikes. When its pure white body bursts through the surface of a bloodstained lake, it resembles nothing more than a blob of fresh cream atop a rolanberry coulis. But with more teeth.

name: Skulleater
textHtml: These scavengers of the deep have a habit of breaking open the heads of drowned sailors with their oversized pincers, before feasting on the grey goodness within and taking up residence in the cleaned-out crania. This earns them few friends in sailing circles.
textClean: These scavengers of the deep have a habit of breaking open the heads of drowned sailors with their oversized pincers, before feasting on the grey goodness within and taking up residence in the cleaned-out crania. This earns them few friends in sailing circles.

name: Toffee Snail
textHtml: The sweet, chewy flesh of these mollusks, flavored with aromatic herbs, is a staple of Kholusian cuisine. The culinary tome “Of Ye Kholusian Kytchenne” also lists recipes for the waffle wasp and the mousse louse─the only known reference to either creature. This has led some scholars to doubt the book's authenticity.
textClean: The sweet, chewy flesh of these mollusks, flavored with aromatic herbs, is a staple of Kholusian cuisine. This has led some scholars to doubt the book's authenticity.

name: Watts Trout
textHtml: A familiar face to all those living along Watts River, this fish has long been an important source of protein for the dwarves who dwell there. When a fisher catches a Watts trout, it is customary to call out its name─the traditional reply being “You should know, you've just caught one.”
textClean: A familiar face to all those living along Watts River, this fish has long been an important source of protein for the dwarves who dwell there. When a fisher catches a Watts trout, it is customary to call out its name─the traditional reply being “You should know, you've just caught one.”

name: South Kholusian Cod
textHtml: This fish is far-famed for its soft, flaky flesh, often forming the centerpiece of a Kholusian banquet. Their erstwhile cousins, the north Kholusian cod, were tougher in both body and spirit, but not tough enough to survive the Flood─now, only the southern softies remain.
textClean: This fish is far-famed for its soft, flaky flesh, often forming the centerpiece of a Kholusian banquet. Their erstwhile cousins, the north Kholusian cod, were tougher in both body and spirit, but not tough enough to survive the Flood─now, only the southern softies remain.

name: Kholusian Flounder
textHtml: Legend has it that these flat, bottom-dwelling wavekin are the reincarnations of those poor, unfortunate souls who wasted away on the road to Eulmore, and chose to throw themselves into the ocean in order to end their suffering early.
textClean: Legend has it that these flat, bottom-dwelling wavekin are the reincarnations of those poor, unfortunate souls who wasted away on the road to Eulmore, and chose to throw themselves into the ocean in order to end their suffering early.

name: Shellfracture Kelp
textHtml: A marine plant that grows in great beds off Cracked Shell Beach. It wraps its meaty leaves around marine mollusks, providing protection in exchange for stability. However, as the kelp grows, its grip tightens and the shells shatter. Below the water, as above, we always hurt the ones we love.
textClean: A marine plant that grows in great beds off Cracked Shell Beach. It wraps its meaty leaves around marine mollusks, providing protection in exchange for stability. However, as the kelp grows, its grip tightens and the shells shatter. Below the water, as above, we always hurt the ones we love.

name: Blood Cloud
textHtml: With their round, red bodies, these wavekin look like so many balloons floating in the summer sky, trailing their strings behind them. But be very wary, for their strings pack a deadly sting. If you should chance upon a swarm whilst swimming, let those red balloons go by.
textClean: With their round, red bodies, these wavekin look like so many balloons floating in the summer sky, trailing their strings behind them. But be very wary, for their strings pack a deadly sting. If you should chance upon a swarm whilst swimming, let those red balloons go by.

name: Rose Shrimp
textHtml: This pretty pink shrimp is a boon to any budding culinarian, lending a fine flavor to many a delicious dish. Some scholars claim that schools of these creatures take the shape of a blooming rose─others that the name is based only on their coloration. So long as argumentative academics abound, the debate may never end.
