textClean: With its majestic winglike fins and muted coloration, this wavekin has an almost ethereal presence. While similar species are found across the world, this specimen in particular has persisted unchanged for eons.

name: Yak T'el Salamander
textHtml: This emerald-tinted giant is said to lurk in the depths with its great maw open, patiently waiting to ambush unsuspecting prey and swallow them whole.
textClean: This emerald-tinted giant is said to lurk in the depths with its great maw open, patiently waiting to ambush unsuspecting prey and swallow them whole.

name: Shadowtongue
textHtml: This ancient wavekin is wreathed in lustrous metallic scales. It is said that in the age of conflict between the Mamool Ja and Xbr'aal, these sturdy scales were used in the making of plate armor and other protective gear.
textClean: This ancient wavekin is wreathed in lustrous metallic scales. It is said that in the age of conflict between the Mamool Ja and Xbr'aal, these sturdy scales were used in the making of plate armor and other protective gear.

name: Cloud-eye Carp
textHtml: A relatively recent discovery in the pantheon of Turali fauna, there is still much to learn about this mysterious wavekin. Lacking eyes altogether, this fish seems to navigate its environs using an array of other senses.
textClean: A relatively recent discovery in the pantheon of Turali fauna, there is still much to learn about this mysterious wavekin. Lacking eyes altogether, this fish seems to navigate its environs using an array of other senses.

name: Xobr'it Lobster
textHtml: Ancestors of this ghostly lobster once had reddish-brown carapaces. When the forests surrounding its habitat were reduced to cinders by the raging fires of war, this species underwent a profound change─the excess ash in the atmosphere bleached their shells to a white-grey sheen.
textClean: Ancestors of this ghostly lobster once had reddish-brown carapaces. When the forests surrounding its habitat were reduced to cinders by the raging fires of war, this species underwent a profound change─the excess ash in the atmosphere bleached their shells to a white-grey sheen.

name: Sunbright Axolotl
textHtml: In combination with its golden hue, the frilled gills that ring this amphibian's head call to mind the blazing sun. Scholars speculate that the motifs adorning some of the ruins in its native region are as much inspired by the creature as the sun itself.
textClean: In combination with its golden hue, the frilled gills that ring this amphibian's head call to mind the blazing sun. Scholars speculate that the motifs adorning some of the ruins in its native region are as much inspired by the creature as the sun itself.

name: Horned Frog
textHtml: This creature's bulbous brownish body helps it blend among fallen leaves and other dead vegetation. Readily identified by the protrusions above its eyes, it is said to detest having its horns mocked. Alas, no horned frog has ever learned the common tongue to corroborate this belief.
textClean: This creature's bulbous brownish body helps it blend among fallen leaves and other dead vegetation. Readily identified by the protrusions above its eyes, it is said to detest having its horns mocked. Alas, no horned frog has ever learned the common tongue to corroborate this belief.

name: Mudfish
textHtml: This wavekin burrows into the mud at the bottom of lakes. They were so commonly discovered by diggers that they were at one point believed to come from the earth itself.
textClean: This wavekin burrows into the mud at the bottom of lakes. They were so commonly discovered by diggers that they were at one point believed to come from the earth itself.

name: Turali Beaded Lizard
textHtml: As potent as beaded lizard venom is, Mamool Ja are immune to its adverse effects, which would certainly explain why Mamook soldiers of eld coated all their arrows in the stuff.
textClean: As potent as beaded lizard venom is, Mamool Ja are immune to its adverse effects, which would certainly explain why Mamook soldiers of eld coated all their arrows in the stuff.

name: Yak T'el Catfish
textHtml: This wavekin puts the “cat” in “catfish,” as they hold a natural curiosity toward people, and many Mamool Ja like to spoil them with treats.
textClean: This wavekin puts the “cat” in “catfish,” as they hold a natural curiosity toward people, and many Mamool Ja like to spoil them with treats.

name: Ankledeep Catfish
textHtml: This catfish is so flat, it can easily conceal itself in the shallows. Those who decide to wade out into the cenote are encouraged to watch their step.
textClean: This catfish is so flat, it can easily conceal itself in the shallows. Those who decide to wade out into the cenote are encouraged to watch their step.

name: Checkered Cichlid
textHtml: Also known as the “wicker fish” due to its alternating dark and light pattern resembling a type of fish basket woven by Mamool Ja crafters.
textClean: Also known as the “wicker fish” due to its alternating dark and light pattern resembling a type of fish basket woven by Mamool Ja crafters.

name: Moxutural Gar
textHtml: On rare occasions, this species rises to the surface for air. Some have suggested perhaps these sociable creatures have grown lonely in the time since Moxutural Zooj was abandoned.
textClean: On rare occasions, this species rises to the surface for air. Some have suggested perhaps these sociable creatures have grown lonely in the time since Moxutural Zooj was abandoned.

name: Variatus
textHtml: One theory has it that this fish was purposely brought here from the Ut'ohmu Horizon, where other similarly vibrant species have been documented.
textClean: One theory has it that this fish was purposely brought here from the Ut'ohmu Horizon, where other similarly vibrant species have been documented.

name: Welkin Catfish
textHtml: According to Yok Huy legend, this species came about when one of their forest-dwelling ancestors sought to capture the night sky.
textClean: According to Yok Huy legend, this species came about when one of their forest-dwelling ancestors sought to capture the night sky.

name: Flawless Saucer
textHtml: Mathematically, this creature's body is a near-perfect circle. The Mamool Ja have used them as ritual platters since time immemorial.
textClean: Mathematically, this creature's body is a near-perfect circle. The Mamool Ja have used them as ritual platters since time immemorial.

name: Glittergill
textHtml: Exposed to the unusual aether of the meteorites, this species has developed a faint, shimmering glow. In Mamook, they are typically given as a wedding gift to young couples.
textClean: Exposed to the unusual aether of the meteorites, this species has developed a faint, shimmering glow. In Mamook, they are typically given as a wedding gift to young couples.

name: Twig Catfish
textHtml: It is said that this thin brown fish evolved to resemble a fallen branch or tree root in order to evade predators. Its algae-based diet helps to “clean up” the water in which it resides.
textClean: It is said that this thin brown fish evolved to resemble a fallen branch or tree root in order to evade predators. Its algae-based diet helps to “clean up” the water in which it resides.

name: Blind Brotula
textHtml: This pale, puny fish may seem helpless at first blush, but its aether-sensitive organs enable it to defend itself with primitive magicks.
textClean: This pale, puny fish may seem helpless at first blush, but its aether-sensitive organs enable it to defend itself with primitive magicks.

name: Yak T'el Caiman
textHtml: It is believed that this sizable beast uses underground waterways to travel here from the ocean. It seizes its prey in its massive jaws and disappears beneath the surface, never to be seen again.
textClean: It is believed that this sizable beast uses underground waterways to travel here from the ocean. It seizes its prey in its massive jaws and disappears beneath the surface, never to be seen again.

name: Ut'ohmu Tiika
textHtml: Its name is a union of two tongues: the Xbr'aal “ut'ohmu” and the Mamool Ja “tiika.” That the Mamool Ja chose this appellation speaks volumes to their yearning for the forest above.
textClean: Its name is a union of two tongues: the Xbr'aal “ut'ohmu” and the Mamool Ja “tiika.” That the Mamool Ja chose this appellation speaks volumes to their yearning for the forest above.

name: Sharknose Goby
textHtml: The blue stripes on its back and golden tinge of its cranial scales serve to further highlight its decidedly sharklike snout.
textClean: The blue stripes on its back and golden tinge of its cranial scales serve to further highlight its decidedly sharklike snout.

name: Yak T'el Crab
textHtml: Xbr'aal folklore describes this crab as a messenger of the underworld. The Mamool Ja, on the other hand, consider it a herald of the heavens above.
textClean: Xbr'aal folklore describes this crab as a messenger of the underworld. The Mamool Ja, on the other hand, consider it a herald of the heavens above.

name: Xty'iinbek Sleeper
textHtml: This fish has vivid, colorful scales that scarcely ever see the light of day. It spends most of its adult life in the ocean, then returns to Xty'iinbek Tsoly to spawn.
textClean: This fish has vivid, colorful scales that scarcely ever see the light of day. It spends most of its adult life in the ocean, then returns to Xty'iinbek Tsoly to spawn.

name: Chain Shark
textHtml: While originally native to the Indigo Deep, a number of these sharks migrated to the cenotes in search of prey and simply never went back.
textClean: While originally native to the Indigo Deep, a number of these sharks migrated to the cenotes in search of prey and simply never went back.

name: Bonytail Chub
textHtml: In contrast with their stout heads and bodies, these fish have extremely thin tails─some little more than skin and bone, hence the name. The caudal fin is forked deeply.
textClean: In contrast with their stout heads and bodies, these fish have extremely thin tails─some little more than skin and bone, hence the name. The caudal fin is forked deeply.

name: Niikwerepi Trout
textHtml: This trout travels along Niikwerepi from lake to lake across its entire lifespan, from the moment of its hatching to maturity and beyond.
textClean: This trout travels along Niikwerepi from lake to lake across its entire lifespan, from the moment of its hatching to maturity and beyond.

name: Pyariyoanaan Cichlid
textHtml: This midsized freshwater fish is said to change the color of its scales based on weather and water currents. As the fisherfolk say: “When the cichlid is brown, the sun sticks around; when the cichlid is blue, rain will pass through.”
textClean: This midsized freshwater fish is said to change the color of its scales based on weather and water currents. As the fisherfolk say: “When the cichlid is brown, the sun sticks around; when the cichlid is blue, rain will pass through.”

name: Shaaloani Salmon
textHtml: During spawn season, its skin turns bright red to attract a mate. Jerky made from this salmon has long been prized as a nonperishable staple in Shaaloani.
textClean: During spawn season, its skin turns bright red to attract a mate. Jerky made from this salmon has long been prized as a nonperishable staple in Shaaloani.

name: Trailtrout
textHtml: It is said that the Hhetsarro study the fat deposits of the trailtrout to get a sense for the changing seasons and plan their next migration.
textClean: It is said that the Hhetsarro study the fat deposits of the trailtrout to get a sense for the changing seasons and plan their next migration.

name: Toari Sucker
textHtml: The Tonawawta traditional swimming style is said to have taken inspiration from the strong and steady movements of the Toari sucker.
textClean: The Tonawawta traditional swimming style is said to have taken inspiration from the strong and steady movements of the Toari sucker.

name: Turali Paddlefish
textHtml: The black roe laid by this paddlefish has long been treasured as a delicacy in Shaaloani. Some are even willing to pay for it in gold.
textClean: The black roe laid by this paddlefish has long been treasured as a delicacy in Shaaloani. Some are even willing to pay for it in gold.

name: Zorgor Core
textHtml: One theory has suggested that these creatures are born from dense pockets of ambient aether, but the truth of it has yet to be ascertained.
textClean: One theory has suggested that these creatures are born from dense pockets of ambient aether, but the truth of it has yet to be ascertained.

name: Cloudribbon
textHtml: Peering over the side of Zorgor the Boundless, it might look as though someone's dropped their favorite blue ribbon, but in most cases it's just a cloudfish riding on updrafts using its tiny membranes.
textClean: Peering over the side of Zorgor the Boundless, it might look as though someone's dropped their favorite blue ribbon, but in most cases it's just a cloudfish riding on updrafts using its tiny membranes.

name: Zorgor Scorpion
textHtml: On occasion, travelers of Zorgor the Boundless may catch sight of one of these scorpions leaping onto the bridge, a helpless cloudribbon in its pincers. What happens next is generally not a treat for the eyes.
textClean: On occasion, travelers of Zorgor the Boundless may catch sight of one of these scorpions leaping onto the bridge, a helpless cloudribbon in its pincers. What happens next is generally not a treat for the eyes.

name: Vagrant Cascade
textHtml: The faint glow of this translucent tube─a result of both fungal and aetheric influences─may lead an unwitting observer to mistake it for a ghostly apparition floating in the mists.
textClean: The faint glow of this translucent tube─a result of both fungal and aetheric influences─may lead an unwitting observer to mistake it for a ghostly apparition floating in the mists.

name: Zorgor Condor
textHtml: This carnivorous predator primarily targets cloudfish, but may sometimes dive at pedestrians crossing Zorgor the Boundless, especially if they appear to be carrying a tasty snack.
textClean: This carnivorous predator primarily targets cloudfish, but may sometimes dive at pedestrians crossing Zorgor the Boundless, especially if they appear to be carrying a tasty snack.

name: Cloud Wasp
textHtml: Colonies of cloud wasps nest in the trestles of Zorgor the Boundless, serving and protecting their queen in much the same fashion as honeybees.
textClean: Colonies of cloud wasps nest in the trestles of Zorgor the Boundless, serving and protecting their queen in much the same fashion as honeybees.

name: Azure Glider
textHtml: Traditionally, the meat is hung to dry for many hours. Locals often recount the story of a traveler who, upon tasting it, leapt straight into the falls from Zorgor the Boundless, spear in hand.
textClean: Traditionally, the meat is hung to dry for many hours. Locals often recount the story of a traveler who, upon tasting it, leapt straight into the falls from Zorgor the Boundless, spear in hand.

name: Hellsnow Shark
textHtml: It is said that a traveling Eorzean angler once spied a school of these airborne sharks while crossing Zorgor the Boundless. Deathly afeared of the wavekin's Abalathian cousins, the angler cried, “Oh, hells no!”─an utterance rarely used in Tural─and promptly ran the other way. Witnesses to this event assumed he was referring to the sharks, and thus was history written.
textClean: It is said that a traveling Eorzean angler once spied a school of these airborne sharks while crossing Zorgor the Boundless. Deathly afeared of the wavekin's Abalathian cousins, the angler cried, “Oh, hells no!”─an utterance rarely used in Tural─and promptly ran the other way. Witnesses to this event assumed he was referring to the sharks, and thus was history written.

name: Heritage Loach
textHtml: This lithe, slender wavekin has long been beloved by the inhabitants of Heritage Found. Capable of readily adapting to even the most severe environmental changes, it has survived numerous calamities in which other, less hardy species have perished.
textClean: This lithe, slender wavekin has long been beloved by the inhabitants of Heritage Found. Capable of readily adapting to even the most severe environmental changes, it has survived numerous calamities in which other, less hardy species have perished.

name: Outskirts Sniffer
textHtml: Despite its name, the snout-like appendage protruding from the head of this fish is actually its mouth. Its form and habits have remained the same for eons. Much like the people of the outskirts, it seems committed to an unchanging existence in the face of upheaval.
textClean: Despite its name, the snout-like appendage protruding from the head of this fish is actually its mouth. Its form and habits have remained the same for eons. Much like the people of the outskirts, it seems committed to an unchanging existence in the face of upheaval.

name: Pumpkin Perch
textHtml: According to Tonawawtan legend, this almost frighteningly fecund fish was born from a pumpkin seed cast into the river. Attempts to recreate the fable have invariably failed to produce results.
textClean: According to Tonawawtan legend, this almost frighteningly fecund fish was born from a pumpkin seed cast into the river. Attempts to recreate the fable have invariably failed to produce results.

name: Tiger Muskellunge
textHtml: This wavekin is a hybrid between two species native to Alexandria and Yyasulani respectively. Although remarkably hardy, it is unable to produce offspring.
textClean: This wavekin is a hybrid between two species native to Alexandria and Yyasulani respectively. Although remarkably hardy, it is unable to produce offspring.

name: Moon Croppie
textHtml: Distributed widely across Yyasulani, this species is prized as a source of food. When cooked, its white flesh becomes wonderfully plump and tender.
textClean: Distributed widely across Yyasulani, this species is prized as a source of food. When cooked, its white flesh becomes wonderfully plump and tender.

name: Driftdowns Trout
textHtml: This trout species somehow survives in the stagnant, waste-filled sediment of the driftdowns. Unsurprisingly, its highly polluted flesh is entirely unsuitable for consumption.
textClean: This trout species somehow survives in the stagnant, waste-filled sediment of the driftdowns. Unsurprisingly, its highly polluted flesh is entirely unsuitable for consumption.

name: Electrobetta
textHtml: This elegant wavekin is wreathed in an eerie purple glow. Naturalists have observed the species ingesting small waterborne fragments of electrope, and speculate that the resultant buildup of electrical charge is responsible for the luminance.
textClean: This elegant wavekin is wreathed in an eerie purple glow. Naturalists have observed the species ingesting small waterborne fragments of electrope, and speculate that the resultant buildup of electrical charge is responsible for the luminance.

name: Thundering Redbelly
textHtml: Come spawning season, this usually unremarkable brown fish undergoes a dazzling visual change. The poetic scholar who named this wavekin likened its vibrant stripes to flashes of lightning during a calamitous thunderstorm.
textClean: Come spawning season, this usually unremarkable brown fish undergoes a dazzling visual change. The poetic scholar who named this wavekin likened its vibrant stripes to flashes of lightning during a calamitous thunderstorm.

name: Yyasulani Bowfin
textHtml: Hailing from a time long before Yyasulani was blighted by the dome's presence, this well-camouflaged wavekin can be found lurking in waters with a potent lightning charge.
textClean: Hailing from a time long before Yyasulani was blighted by the dome's presence, this well-camouflaged wavekin can be found lurking in waters with a potent lightning charge.

name: Crackling Flounder
textHtml: With its faint turquoise glow, this charming flounder is said to rival the most precious of gems in terms of sheer beauty. Unfortunately, given the hazardous environment it inhabits, getting close enough to marvel at this fish is rarely worth the risk to life and limb.
textClean: With its faint turquoise glow, this charming flounder is said to rival the most precious of gems in terms of sheer beauty. Unfortunately, given the hazardous environment it inhabits, getting close enough to marvel at this fish is rarely worth the risk to life and limb.

name: Goldgrouper
textHtml: A resplendent golden wavekin found amongst the submerged ruins of Alexandria. The excess lightning energy that permeates the area has imbued its scales with metallic strength and a chrome-like sheen.
textClean: A resplendent golden wavekin found amongst the submerged ruins of Alexandria. The excess lightning energy that permeates the area has imbued its scales with metallic strength and a chrome-like sheen.

name: Everkeep Yabby
textHtml: This crustacean is found in waterways throughout Everkeep. A culinary favorite, steamed yabby is often paired with a variety of colorful but questionable sauces.
textClean: This crustacean is found in waterways throughout Everkeep. A culinary favorite, steamed yabby is often paired with a variety of colorful but questionable sauces.

name: Stickleback
textHtml: The row of pointed spines that adorn this wavekin's back act as a deterrent to predators. Incidentally, the appellation “stickleback” is used to deride the startling fashion choices made by wayward youths.
textClean: The row of pointed spines that adorn this wavekin's back act as a deterrent to predators. Incidentally, the appellation “stickleback” is used to deride the startling fashion choices made by wayward youths.

name: Custodian Carp
textHtml: An unabashed omnivore, this wavekin will happily consume whatever it can fit inside its mouth. Hoping to capitalize on this unfussy approach to feeding─and thereby get rid of unwanted pests─cleaners have released several specimens into the artificial ponds of Solution Nine's residential sector.
textClean: An unabashed omnivore, this wavekin will happily consume whatever it can fit inside its mouth. Hoping to capitalize on this unfussy approach to feeding─and thereby get rid of unwanted pests─cleaners have released several specimens into the artificial ponds of Solution Nine's residential sector.

name: Mosaic Loach
textHtml: The pattern covering this streamlined fish resembles a smattering of multicolored pebbles. It is unclear whether its name derives from this coloration, or from it being a firm favorite among employees at Solution Nine's premier café.
textClean: The pattern covering this streamlined fish resembles a smattering of multicolored pebbles. It is unclear whether its name derives from this coloration, or from it being a firm favorite among employees at Solution Nine's premier café.

name: Rosebud Frog
textHtml: Legend has it that this amphibian first emerged into the world from a red rosebud. Given the species' love of nectar, scholars have surmised that whoever was responsible for the tale simply misinterpreted the sight of a young frog enjoying a fragrant meal.
textClean: Legend has it that this amphibian first emerged into the world from a red rosebud. Given the species' love of nectar, scholars have surmised that whoever was responsible for the tale simply misinterpreted the sight of a young frog enjoying a fragrant meal.

name: Knight Goby
textHtml: This valorous wavekin is the national fish of Alexandria. Revered as a symbol of loyalty, its silver scales invite comparisons to the realm's armored knights.
textClean: This valorous wavekin is the national fish of Alexandria. Revered as a symbol of loyalty, its silver scales invite comparisons to the realm's armored knights.

name: Windspath Eel
textHtml: Readily identified by the faintly unsettling eye-like markings that adorn their tails, wild specimens are usually light brown. In the abnormally pure waters of Windspath Gardens, however, this eel has developed a muted, almost transparent hue.
textClean: Readily identified by the faintly unsettling eye-like markings that adorn their tails, wild specimens are usually light brown. In the abnormally pure waters of Windspath Gardens, however, this eel has developed a muted, almost transparent hue.

name: Harlequin Lancer
textHtml: The black and yellow splotches that cover this wavekin's body bring to mind the gaudy costumes of clowns and jesters. Yet far from serving to entertain, these vibrant colors warn predators that the lancer's flesh is filled with deadly toxins.
textClean: The black and yellow splotches that cover this wavekin's body bring to mind the gaudy costumes of clowns and jesters. Yet far from serving to entertain, these vibrant colors warn predators that the lancer's flesh is filled with deadly toxins.

name: Cleyran Carp
textHtml: This jet black carp is one of a few surviving specimens from Cleyra. Sadly, many other wavekin native to the region now exist only as entries in textbooks and scholarly journals.
textClean: This jet black carp is one of a few surviving specimens from Cleyra. Sadly, many other wavekin native to the region now exist only as entries in textbooks and scholarly journals.

name: Giant Snakehead
textHtml: Possessing primitive lungs, this sizable fish is often seen surfacing for air. When observing such behavior, even the most experienced naturalists have been known to mistake its blunt head for that of a scalekin.
textClean: Possessing primitive lungs, this sizable fish is often seen surfacing for air. When observing such behavior, even the most experienced naturalists have been known to mistake its blunt head for that of a scalekin.

name: Datnioides
textHtml: The young fry of these striped predators are highly susceptible to aetheric fluctuations─a phenomenon which manifests itself in their vibrant scales. As the species matures, this susceptibility wanes, along with the coloration.
textClean: The young fry of these striped predators are highly susceptible to aetheric fluctuations─a phenomenon which manifests itself in their vibrant scales. As the species matures, this susceptibility wanes, along with the coloration.

name: Neo Arowana
textHtml: Native to a now-lost realm, this species' survival is credited to Alexandrian hobbyists who bred the fish for its iridescent appearance.
textClean: Native to a now-lost realm, this species' survival is credited to Alexandrian hobbyists who bred the fish for its iridescent appearance.

name: Canal Bream
textHtml: This wavekin was a popular source of food in the port settlement Canal Town was based on. It is said that young chefs tasked with filleting the fish were often put off by its large, posthumously watchful eyes.
textClean: This wavekin was a popular source of food in the port settlement Canal Town was based on. It is said that young chefs tasked with filleting the fish were often put off by its large, posthumously watchful eyes.

name: Iris Wrasse
textHtml: In the past, Endless would flock to the balustrades for a glimpse of these vibrant shoaling fish in the canals, likening their flowing form to a wildflower meadow astir in the wind.
textClean: In the past, Endless would flock to the balustrades for a glimpse of these vibrant shoaling fish in the canals, likening their flowing form to a wildflower meadow astir in the wind.

name: Canal Drum
textHtml: In days gone by, the thoroughfares of Canal Town would often be thronged with crowds watching one of the resort's many musical troupes. This rounded wavekin takes its name from the drums used in such performances. Appellation aside, tapping out a triplet or two on its scales is discouraged.
textClean: In days gone by, the thoroughfares of Canal Town would often be thronged with crowds watching one of the resort's many musical troupes. This rounded wavekin takes its name from the drums used in such performances. Appellation aside, tapping out a triplet or two on its scales is discouraged.

name: Butterfly Ray
textHtml: This elongated oval ray looks like an oversized butterfly come to rest with its wings unfurled. Referencing the wavekin's color, some needlessly petty naturalists insist that it actually bears closer resemblance to a moth.
textClean: This elongated oval ray looks like an oversized butterfly come to rest with its wings unfurled. Referencing the wavekin's color, some needlessly petty naturalists insist that it actually bears closer resemblance to a moth.

name: Hydro Louvar
textHtml: Favoring warm, temperate waters, this wavekin once roamed oceans far and wide. Sadly, its present habitat rather curtails these migratory tendencies.
textClean: Favoring warm, temperate waters, this wavekin once roamed oceans far and wide. Sadly, its present habitat rather curtails these migratory tendencies.

name: Devotion Clam
textHtml: A beige bivalve originally hailing from a region of expansive shallows. This highly nutritious and exquisitely flavorsome creature was once a frequent fixture on dining tables across Alexandria.
textClean: A beige bivalve originally hailing from a region of expansive shallows. This highly nutritious and exquisitely flavorsome creature was once a frequent fixture on dining tables across Alexandria.

name: Forgotten One
textHtml: The Meso Terminal contains nary a record on this fish, nor the circumstances surrounding its introduction to the resort. The whys, hows, and wheres of its existence are a mystery that will likely persist forevermore.
textClean: The Meso Terminal contains nary a record on this fish, nor the circumstances surrounding its introduction to the resort. The whys, hows, and wheres of its existence are a mystery that will likely persist forevermore.

name: Copper Shark
textHtml: Relatives of this gargantuan rust-tinged shark voraciously stalk their prey in temperate seas. This particular species is comparatively docile, and seems content to trawl the waters of Living Memory for plankton and other microbial organisms.
textClean: Relatives of this gargantuan rust-tinged shark voraciously stalk their prey in temperate seas. This particular species is comparatively docile, and seems content to trawl the waters of Living Memory for plankton and other microbial organisms.

name: Golden Day
textHtml: This wavekin and its dull golden scales has become a symbol of nostalgic reminiscence─calling to mind the faded glory of bygone days. Despite the somber association, the sight of this charming fish has soothed many an onlooker over the years.
textClean: This wavekin and its dull golden scales has become a symbol of nostalgic reminiscence─calling to mind the faded glory of bygone days. Despite the somber association, the sight of this charming fish has soothed many an onlooker over the years.

name: Starglass Gibel
textHtml: Glinting with a starry luster, this fish takes its name from the Yesterland plaza. Bereft of a natural night sky, people would turn their gaze to the waterways and watch these graceful wavekin float and frolic, inventing new constellations based on their positions in the current.
textClean: Glinting with a starry luster, this fish takes its name from the Yesterland plaza. Bereft of a natural night sky, people would turn their gaze to the waterways and watch these graceful wavekin float and frolic, inventing new constellations based on their positions in the current.

name: Scarlet Queen
textHtml: This beautiful, selectively bred species was awarded to the royal family upon Queen Sphene's resurrection as an Endless.
textClean: This beautiful, selectively bred species was awarded to the royal family upon Queen Sphene's resurrection as an Endless.

name: Ultimoat Carp
textHtml: This large wavekin was once a domineering presence in Alexandria's castle moat. When the realm was reborn as Proto Alexandria, the few remaining carp also found themselves enjoying a new lease on life.
textClean: This large wavekin was once a domineering presence in Alexandria's castle moat. When the realm was reborn as Proto Alexandria, the few remaining carp also found themselves enjoying a new lease on life.

name: Icuvlo's Barter
textHtml: Bearing the name of the Pelu god of wealth, this tiny amphibian is said to guide travelers to the fabled golden city. This association likely comes from the toxin secreted by the frog, which induces a debilitating sensitivity to light, giving the world around the victim a dazzling gilded sheen.
textClean: Bearing the name of the Pelu god of wealth, this tiny amphibian is said to guide travelers to the fabled golden city. This association likely comes from the toxin secreted by the frog, which induces a debilitating sensitivity to light, giving the world around the victim a dazzling gilded sheen.

name: Moongripper
textHtml: On moonlit nights, this crustacean lifts its mighty pincers aloft, reaching out as if to pluck the pockmarked satellite right out of the sky. According to Yok Huy legend, specimens that successfully grasp the moon's image in their claws grow to be stronger and larger than their counterparts.
textClean: On moonlit nights, this crustacean lifts its mighty pincers aloft, reaching out as if to pluck the pockmarked satellite right out of the sky. According to Yok Huy legend, specimens that successfully grasp the moon's image in their claws grow to be stronger and larger than their counterparts.

name: Cazuela Crab
textHtml: Considered a delicacy by the Hanuhanu, the preferred method of preparing this weighty crustacean is to simply place it atop a boiling cookpot and steam the crab, carapace and all.
textClean: Considered a delicacy by the Hanuhanu, the preferred method of preparing this weighty crustacean is to simply place it atop a boiling cookpot and steam the crab, carapace and all.

name: Ilyon Asoh Cichlid
textHtml: This beautiful, vibrant wavekin is beloved by the Xbr'aal, and, in times past, was enshrined as a deity in Ilyon Asoh. So profound was the villagers' reverence that they saw fit to ban fishing for the divine creature on all but a handful of days each year.
textClean: This beautiful, vibrant wavekin is beloved by the Xbr'aal, and, in times past, was enshrined as a deity in Ilyon Asoh. So profound was the villagers' reverence that they saw fit to ban fishing for the divine creature on all but a handful of days each year.

name: Stardust Sleeper
textHtml: Although known to also inhabit the Stardust Sea, this secretive wavekin favors the deep, briny waters of Xty'iinbek Tsoly. As such, sightings are few and far between.
textClean: Although known to also inhabit the Stardust Sea, this secretive wavekin favors the deep, briny waters of Xty'iinbek Tsoly. As such, sightings are few and far between.

name: Hwittayoanaan Cichlid
textHtml: Among the several species of cichlid native to the region, this particular specimen is often seen in the waters closest to the Boughs of Hwittayoanaan. Naturalists have posited that the wavekin's heightened olfactory senses lure it towards the Hhetsarro's open-air burial grounds.
textClean: Among the several species of cichlid native to the region, this particular specimen is often seen in the waters closest to the Boughs of Hwittayoanaan. Naturalists have posited that the wavekin's heightened olfactory senses lure it towards the Hhetsarro's open-air burial grounds.

name: Thunderswift Trout
textHtml: Deftly navigating the detritus-strewn waters at impossible speeds, there is nary an ilm of the driftdowns safe from this fearsome fish.
textClean: Deftly navigating the detritus-strewn waters at impossible speeds, there is nary an ilm of the driftdowns safe from this fearsome fish.

name: Pixel Loach
textHtml: Reminiscent of the display panels utilized throughout Everkeep, the intricate patterns adorning this wavekin shift and shimmer as it swims. When exposed to an electrical current, these markings cycle through an exuberant myriad of colors, much to the delight of any onlookers.
textClean: Reminiscent of the display panels utilized throughout Everkeep, the intricate patterns adorning this wavekin shift and shimmer as it swims. When exposed to an electrical current, these markings cycle through an exuberant myriad of colors, much to the delight of any onlookers.

name: Cloudsail
textHtml: With its oversized dorsal fin and aerodynamic snout, this wavekin can be glimpsed soaring through the mists betwixt Yok and Xak Tural. Much like the clouds that blanket its natural habitat, the flesh of this toothsome fish is light and fluffy, making it a popular ingredient in a variety of local dishes.
textClean: With its oversized dorsal fin and aerodynamic snout, this wavekin can be glimpsed soaring through the mists betwixt Yok and Xak Tural. Much like the clouds that blanket its natural habitat, the flesh of this toothsome fish is light and fluffy, making it a popular ingredient in a variety of local dishes.

name: Oily Ropefish
textHtml: This wavekin secretes a coat of oily mucus that allows it to adapt to subtle changes in water temperature, and is prized by artisans for its utility in the production of heavy-duty lubricants.
textClean: This wavekin secretes a coat of oily mucus that allows it to adapt to subtle changes in water temperature, and is prized by artisans for its utility in the production of heavy-duty lubricants.

name: Yak Awak Core
textHtml: Found in the depths of Yak Awak Tsoly, these twinkling spheroid creatures are a valuable (if somewhat dim) light source for the people of the Ut'ohmu Horizon.
textClean: Found in the depths of Yak Awak Tsoly, these twinkling spheroid creatures are a valuable (if somewhat dim) light source for the people of the Ut'ohmu Horizon.

name: Inktopus
textHtml: Like many octopodes, this wavekin hides in a cloud of its own ink when threatened. After sailors noticed that this particular ink left a nearly permanent stain upon everything it touched, it was soon adopted for use in nautical mapmaking.
textClean: Like many octopodes, this wavekin hides in a cloud of its own ink when threatened. After sailors noticed that this particular ink left a nearly permanent stain upon everything it touched, it was soon adopted for use in nautical mapmaking.

name: Honeycomb Sponge
textHtml: This aquatic invertebrate was named for the hexagonal pores in its spongin mesh. Once its living cells have been cruelly stripped away, its skeletal remains can be used to create luxurious lathers with the soap of one's choice.
textClean: This aquatic invertebrate was named for the hexagonal pores in its spongin mesh. Once its living cells have been cruelly stripped away, its skeletal remains can be used to create luxurious lathers with the soap of one's choice.

name: Cenote Oyster
textHtml: The thick shell of this wavekin, found only in saltwater cenotes, is pulverized and added to soil to improve its drainage. Historically, this has saved countless structures from damage during heavy rain.
textClean: The thick shell of this wavekin, found only in saltwater cenotes, is pulverized and added to soil to improve its drainage. Historically, this has saved countless structures from damage during heavy rain.

name: Cabinkeep Permit
textHtml: Compared to its timid lesser brethren, this wavekin is bestowed with a positively brazen temperament, and is often spotted leading shoals around the shallows near the For'ard Cabins with a self-assured grace. Guests have likened its presence to that of a conscientious, well-versed caretaker.
textClean: Compared to its timid lesser brethren, this wavekin is bestowed with a positively brazen temperament, and is often spotted leading shoals around the shallows near the For'ard Cabins with a self-assured grace. Guests have likened its presence to that of a conscientious, well-versed caretaker.

name: Muttering Matamata
textHtml: As pleated matamata age, their shells continue to grow indefinitely. According to legend, the largest and most ancient specimens eventually fuse with the landscape, blocking rivers in the process─the once-mighty roar of water reduced to a mere muttering. Though naturalists have yet to observe the phenomena in the wild, this specimen renders the tales believable.
textClean: As pleated matamata age, their shells continue to grow indefinitely. According to legend, the largest and most ancient specimens eventually fuse with the landscape, blocking rivers in the process─the once-mighty roar of water reduced to a mere muttering. Though naturalists have yet to observe the phenomena in the wild, this specimen renders the tales believable.

name: Riverlong Candiru
textHtml: Capable of singlehandedly reducing the largest of predators to naught but a pile of polished bones, this wavekin combines the voraciousness of its kin with an independent tenacity that is chilling to behold.
textClean: Capable of singlehandedly reducing the largest of predators to naught but a pile of polished bones, this wavekin combines the voraciousness of its kin with an independent tenacity that is chilling to behold.

name: Deep Canopy
textHtml: The rhomboid form of this pale yellow fish closely resembles fallen foliage. Indeed, local folklore tells of leaves borne on the wind morphing into wavekin after alighting on the surface of the Iq Br'aax reservoir.
textClean: The rhomboid form of this pale yellow fish closely resembles fallen foliage. Indeed, local folklore tells of leaves borne on the wind morphing into wavekin after alighting on the surface of the Iq Br'aax reservoir.

name: Awaksbane Apoda
textHtml: Despite being considerably larger than other apoda, this ancient amphibian's chief form of defense remains the same: secreting a highly toxic slime. Unlike its smaller cousins, however, it produces toxins in such quantities as to blight the waters of the tsoly it calls home.
textClean: Despite being considerably larger than other apoda, this ancient amphibian's chief form of defense remains the same: secreting a highly toxic slime. Unlike its smaller cousins, however, it produces toxins in such quantities as to blight the waters of the tsoly it calls home.

name: Ttokatoa
textHtml: The dense black roe laid by this wavekin sink down to the substrate where it spends much of its time. Known in the Hhetsarro tongue as the “swallower of dawn,” to witness this wavekin's gaping maw loom up from the depths of Lake Toari is to keenly understand the origins of its name.
textClean: The dense black roe laid by this wavekin sink down to the substrate where it spends much of its time. Known in the Hhetsarro tongue as the “swallower of dawn,” to witness this wavekin's gaping maw loom up from the depths of Lake Toari is to keenly understand the origins of its name.

name: Thunderous Flounder
textHtml: When the scales of this flat fish catch the light, they appear to coruscate with electrical energy. This startling effect is all the more pronounced when lightning strikes nearby.
textClean: When the scales of this flat fish catch the light, they appear to coruscate with electrical energy. This startling effect is all the more pronounced when lightning strikes nearby.

name: Harlequin Queen
textHtml: Routinely observed leading retinues of harlequin lancers with magnanimous poise, this regal wavekin lashes out with its venomous barbels to fell prey with deadly precision.
textClean: Routinely observed leading retinues of harlequin lancers with magnanimous poise, this regal wavekin lashes out with its venomous barbels to fell prey with deadly precision.

name: Goldentail
textHtml: Struck daily by the lightning that pours into the crackling canyons, this eel is valued for its delicate-yet-flavorful flesh that notably numbs the tongue with an electrifying spiciness.
textClean: Struck daily by the lightning that pours into the crackling canyons, this eel is valued for its delicate-yet-flavorful flesh that notably numbs the tongue with an electrifying spiciness.

name: Purple Palate
textHtml: It is believed that in the basin's pristine depths, the currents churned by Ku'uxage's falls transform themselves into aether-rich wavekin. Thus does the purple palate surely share the refined tastes of its Ku'uxage parent-waters' grand “tongue.”
textClean: It is believed that in the basin's pristine depths, the currents churned by Ku'uxage's falls transform themselves into aether-rich wavekin. Thus does the purple palate surely share the refined tastes of its Ku'uxage parent-waters' grand “tongue.”

name: Sunray Ray
textHtml: This carefree ray lives happily amongst the clouds, guided only by the wind and its own sense of adventure. Not even capture can unsettle its insouciance, as it tends to bond with the fisher that reels it in.
textClean: This carefree ray lives happily amongst the clouds, guided only by the wind and its own sense of adventure. Not even capture can unsettle its insouciance, as it tends to bond with the fisher that reels it in.

name: Prime Adjudicator
textHtml: With a lifespan that exceeds even that of Yok Huy, this enormous wavekin commands the depths of Karvarhur the First while robed in thick swaths of lichen that bespeak its ancient legacy.
textClean: With a lifespan that exceeds even that of Yok Huy, this enormous wavekin commands the depths of Karvarhur the First while robed in thick swaths of lichen that bespeak its ancient legacy.

name: Crenicichla Miyaka
textHtml: This large specimen of crenicichla dominates the shoreline waters of Miyakabek'zoma, boasting the elegant and unmarred fins of an absolute victor.
textClean: This large specimen of crenicichla dominates the shoreline waters of Miyakabek'zoma, boasting the elegant and unmarred fins of an absolute victor.

name: Iron Shadowtongue
textHtml: While the skins of related species can be processed into armor, the sable scales of this primordial wavekin boast even greater toughness, and are sturdy enough to substitute as weaponry without alteration.
textClean: While the skins of related species can be processed into armor, the sable scales of this primordial wavekin boast even greater toughness, and are sturdy enough to substitute as weaponry without alteration.

name: Lotl-in-waiting
textHtml: Said to spring forth from sunbeams as radiant droplets, these wavekin are worth their weight in gold, for they have long been considered the ideal gift to ingratiate oneself with those in high places.
textClean: Said to spring forth from sunbeams as radiant droplets, these wavekin are worth their weight in gold, for they have long been considered the ideal gift to ingratiate oneself with those in high places.

name: Azure Diver
textHtml: This acrobatic wavekin is often seen leaping skyward before plummeting straight and true into the mists it calls home. On one occasion, a particularly dextrous specimen found itself the target of a mysterious traveler's probing spear tip. Predicting a swift skewering, onlookers were instead treated to a dazzling aerial display as the creature nimbly evaded defeat.
textClean: This acrobatic wavekin is often seen leaping skyward before plummeting straight and true into the mists it calls home. On one occasion, a particularly dextrous specimen found itself the target of a mysterious traveler's probing spear tip. Predicting a swift skewering, onlookers were instead treated to a dazzling aerial display as the creature nimbly evaded defeat.

name: Sprouting Perch
textHtml: On closer inspection, the speckled markings that adorn this wavekin are actually bud-like protrusions. Any fish lured close by the apparition of a sprouting buffet usually find themselves on the menu instead.
textClean: On closer inspection, the speckled markings that adorn this wavekin are actually bud-like protrusions. Any fish lured close by the apparition of a sprouting buffet usually find themselves on the menu instead.

name: Gigagiant Snakehead
textHtml: Boasting a cavernous set of lungs proportionate to their gargantuan size, these fish have been recorded subsisting on a single lungful of air before breaching the surface again. It is difficult to assess which is more impressive─the wavekin's physical attributes, or the patience of the naturalists who waited for days on end to make such an observation.
textClean: Boasting a cavernous set of lungs proportionate to their gargantuan size, these fish have been recorded subsisting on a single lungful of air before breaching the surface again. It is difficult to assess which is more impressive─the wavekin's physical attributes, or the patience of the naturalists who waited for days on end to make such an observation.

name: Gondola Louvar
textHtml: This saltwater fish can be found languidly roaming the waterways of Canal Town, shoals of lesser wavekin in tow. To exert control over its territory, it plies the same routes back and forth with the consistency of a commercial ferry service.
textClean: This saltwater fish can be found languidly roaming the waterways of Canal Town, shoals of lesser wavekin in tow. To exert control over its territory, it plies the same routes back and forth with the consistency of a commercial ferry service.

name: Purse of Riches
textHtml: Clad in glinting golden scales, these substantial wavekin resemble pouches laden with coin. Those fooled by the illusion often dive into the water after glimpsing the fish, visions of wealth soon vanishing with the creature's retreating form.
textClean: Clad in glinting golden scales, these substantial wavekin resemble pouches laden with coin. Those fooled by the illusion often dive into the water after glimpsing the fish, visions of wealth soon vanishing with the creature's retreating form.

name: Punutiy Pain
textHtml: Although known to primarily target hapless peddlers and other waterside wanderers, with increased punutiy traffic in the region, these voracious carnivores now enjoy a more varied diet─much to the chagrin of the punutiy handlers and their gentle charges.
textClean: Although known to primarily target hapless peddlers and other waterside wanderers, with increased punutiy traffic in the region, these voracious carnivores now enjoy a more varied diet─much to the chagrin of the punutiy handlers and their gentle charges.

name: Shuckfin Dace
textHtml: Some scholars have likened this wavekin's form to an ear of corn. Indeed, the sight of these fish basking in the sun with their silk-like tailfins aquiver is akin to that of a golden field, ripe kernels ready to harvest.
textClean: Some scholars have likened this wavekin's form to an ear of corn. Indeed, the sight of these fish basking in the sun with their silk-like tailfins aquiver is akin to that of a golden field, ripe kernels ready to harvest.

name: Shin Snuffler
textHtml: A species of flat catfish residing in the shallow waters of Ankledeep. Locals wading in are often met with the tickling touch of barbels as the pool's residents greet their shins with cautious interest.
textClean: A species of flat catfish residing in the shallow waters of Ankledeep. Locals wading in are often met with the tickling touch of barbels as the pool's residents greet their shins with cautious interest.

name: Moxutural Greatgar
textHtml: Presiding over Cenote Moxutural with an apparent sense of ownership, this mighty gar once frolicked with local residents. Since the nearby village fell silent, however, it has kept a lonesome vigil in the depths.
textClean: Presiding over Cenote Moxutural with an apparent sense of ownership, this mighty gar once frolicked with local residents. Since the nearby village fell silent, however, it has kept a lonesome vigil in the depths.

name: Heirloom Goldgrouper
textHtml: This golden wavekin is found in the deepest recesses beyond the submerged skyline. Infused with lightning energy, it wreaths itself in scraps of metal, darting through the water in a flash of scale and steel.
textClean: This golden wavekin is found in the deepest recesses beyond the submerged skyline. Infused with lightning energy, it wreaths itself in scraps of metal, darting through the water in a flash of scale and steel.

name: Datnioides Aeroplanos
textHtml: In certain lights, this striped predator appears iridescent, its coloration shifting and shimmering as if stirred by the wind.
textClean: In certain lights, this striped predator appears iridescent, its coloration shifting and shimmering as if stirred by the wind.

name: Esperance Carp
textHtml: These large and lively specimens are descended from the wavekin that once dwelled in Alexandria's castle moat. Eager to see the population flourish, naturalists chose to enshrine their hope in the naming of the fish.
textClean: These large and lively specimens are descended from the wavekin that once dwelled in Alexandria's castle moat. Eager to see the population flourish, naturalists chose to enshrine their hope in the naming of the fish.
